en: Now there was a certain man of Ramathaim-zophim, of the hill-country of Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite:
hmr: Ephraim tlâng rama Ramathaim- zophim khuoa chun mi pakhat a um a, a hming chu Elkana a nih; ama chu Jeroham naupa a na, ama chu Elihu naupa a na, ama chu Tohu naupa a na, ama chu Ephraim mi Zuph naupa a nih.

en: and he had two wives; the name of the one was Hannah, and the name of the other Peninnah: and Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.
hmr: Nuhmei pahni a nei a, pakhat hming chu Hanna a na, a dang hming chu Peninna a nih; chun, Peninna chun nauhai a nei a, Hanna ruok chun nau a nei ve nawh a.

en: And this man went up out of his city from year to year to worship and to sacrifice unto Jehovah of hosts in Shiloh. And the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, priests unto Jehovah, were there.
hmr: Chun, ama chu an khuoa in- thawkin Silo khuoah sipaihai LALPA chu be dingin kum tin a hang fe hlak a. Chutaka chun Eli naupasalhai pahni, Hophni le Phinehas, LALPA thiempuhai chu an um a.

en: And when the day came that Elkanah sacrificed, he gave to Peninnah his wife, and to all her sons and her daughters, portions:
hmr: Chun, Elkana inthâwi ni a hung tlung chun a nuhmei Peninna le a naupasalhai le a naunuhai po po chu chanvo a siempêk a.

en: but unto Hannah he gave a double portion; for he loved Hannah, but Jehovah had shut up her womb.
hmr: Hanna ta ding ruok chun chan hni a siempêk a, Hanna chu a hmangai êm êm sih a; nisienla- khawm, LALPAIN a sul a sukping- pêk a.

en: And her rival provoked her sore, to make her fret, because Jehovah had shut up her womb.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN a sul a suk- pingpêk leiin a lungngaina chu chawktho tumin a khingpui chun a lo thaw rawp hlak a.

en: And as he did so year by year, when she went up to the house of Jehovah, so she provoked her; therefore she wept, and did not eat.
hmr: Chuong anga kum tin a lo thaw hlak leiin, LALPA ina a hang fe zâtin a lungngaina chu amanu chun a lo chawktho hlak a. Chuleiin, Hanna chu a ṭap a ṭap a, bu khawm a fâk nawh a.

en: And Elkanah her husband said unto her, Hannah, why weepest thou? and why eatest thou not? and why is thy heart grieved? am not I better to thee than ten sons?
hmr: Chun, a pasal Elkana chun a kuomah, “Hanna, ieng dinga i ṭap am? Ieng dinga bu i fâk naw am a na? Ieng dinga i lungril i suknat am? Nau- pasal sâwm nêk khawmin i ta dingin ka ṭha lem a ni naw am a nih?” a ta.

en: So Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh, and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest was sitting upon his seat by the door-post of the temple of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Silo khuoa bu an fâk a an dâwn zo chun Hanna chu a tho a. Thiempu Eli chu LALPA biek in kawtkhâr ban bula a ṭhungnaa chun a ṭhung a.

en: And she was in bitterness of soul, and prayed unto Jehovah, and wept sore.
hmr: Chun, Hanna chu a lungril a lunginzîng êm êm el a, LALPA kuomah a ṭawngṭai a, lungsetakin a ṭap a.

en: And she vowed a vow, and said, O Jehovah of hosts, if thou wilt indeed look on the affliction of thy handmaid, and remember me, and not forget thy handmaid, but wilt give unto thy handmaid a man-child, then I will give him unto Jehovah all the days of his life, and there shall no razor come upon his head.
hmr: Chun, thu a tiem a, “Aw sipaihai LALPA, i suoknu tlâwmzie hi i hriet tak meu a, i mi hriet zing a, i suoknu hi i mi theinghil nawh a, i suoknu hi naupasal i pêk chun a dam sûng po chu LALPA pe ve thung ka ta, a lu khawm vâw hrim hrim ni naw ni,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, as she continued praying before Jehovah, that Eli marked her mouth.
hmr: Chun, LALPA hmaa a ṭawngṭai zing lai chun Eli chun a hmûr châng chu a lo inchik a.

en: Now Hannah, she spake in her heart; only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard: therefore Eli thought she had been drunken.
hmr: Hanna chun a lungrilin a hril a, a hmûr chu a châng a, a râwl chu hriet a ni nawh a; chuleiin, Eli chun zu ân rui niin a ring a.

en: And Eli said unto her, How long wilt thou be drunken? put away thy wine from thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, Eli chun a kuomah, “Ieng chen am inrui zinga i um ding a na? I uoin chu sie hmang raw khai,” a ta.

en: And Hannah answered and said, No, my lord, I am a woman of a sorrowful spirit: I have drunk neither wine nor strong drink, but I poured out my soul before Jehovah.
hmr: Hanna chun a dawn a, “Ni lo, ka lalpa, nuhmei lungril lungngai tâwp- khâwk ka na; uoin khawm, zupui khawm ka dâwn dêr nawh a, LALPA hmaa chun ka lungril ka phawr lem a nih.

en: Count not thy handmaid for a wicked woman; for out of the abundance of my complaint and my provocation have I spoken hitherto.
hmr: I suoknu hi Belial naunuah inbûk naw raw khai; ka lungrila sip liem ka lungninawna le ka lung- ngaina ka hril a ni hi,” a ta.

en: Then Eli answered and said, Go in peace; and the God of Israel grant thy petition that thou hast asked of him.
hmr: Eli chun, “Lungmuongtakin fe raw khai, Israelhai Pathien chun i thil hni chu pe raw se che,” a tih a, a dawn a.

en: And she said, Let thy handmaid find favor in thy sight. So the woman went her way, and did eat; and her countenance was no more sad.
hmr: Ama chun, “I siehlawnu hi i mittlung ni raw se,” a ta. Chuong- chun, nuhmei chu a fe tah a, bu dâm a fâk a, lungngai hmêl a put ta nawh a.

en: And they rose up in the morning early, and worshipped before Jehovah, and returned, and came to their house to Ramah. And Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and Jehovah remembered her;
hmr: Chun, zingkâr an tho a, LALPA chu an biek a, an fe tah a, Rama khuoa an in chu an tlung nâwk tah a; chun, Elkana chun a nuhmei Hanna chu a pâwl a, chun, LALPAIN ama chu a hriet zing a.

en: and it came to pass, when the time was come about, that Hannah conceived, and bare a son; and she called his name Samuel, saying, Because I have asked him of Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Hanna chun nau a vawn a; a hun a hung tlung chun naupasal a nei a, “LALPA ka ihni a nih,” tiin a hminga chun Samuel a sak a.

en: And the man Elkanah, and all his house, went up to offer unto Jehovah the yearly sacrifice, and his vow.
hmr: Chun, Elkana le a sûnghai po po chu LALPA kuoma an kum tin inthâwina inhlân ding le an thutiem hlen dingin an hang feh a.

en: But Hannah went not up; for she said unto her husband, I will not go up until the child be weaned; and then I will bring him, that he may appear before Jehovah, and there abide for ever.
hmr: Hanna ruok chu a hang fe ve nawh a; a pasal kuoma chun, “Kei chu naute hin nêne nêk a bân hmakhat chu hang fe ve naw ning ah; chu pha ruok chun LALPA hmaha ân lang theina dingin ṭhuoi ka ta, chutaka chun um zing el tâng a tih,” a ta.

en: And Elkanah her husband said unto her, Do what seemeth thee good; tarry until thou have weaned him; only Jehovah establish his word. So the woman tarried and gave her son suck, until she weaned him.
hmr: A pasal Elkana chun a kuomah, “Ṭha âwma i ti ang phawt chun thaw el rawh; a nêne nêk în bântir chenin um rawh, amiruokchu, LALPA chun a thu chu sukdet ngei raw se,” a ta. Chuongchun, a nêne nêk bân hma- khat chun nuhmei chu a um tah a, a naupa chu a enkawl a.

en: And when she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bullocks, and one ephah of meal, and a bottle of wine, and brought him unto the house of Jehovah in Shiloh: and the child was young.
hmr: Chun, nêne nêk ân bântir phing chun beiphit epha khat le uoin saidawiûm khat chawiin sebâwng pathum leh a hang ṭhuoi a, Silo khuoa LALPA ina chun a fepui a; naupang chu a la naupang hleh a.

en: And they slew the bullock, and brought the child to Eli.
hmr: Chun, bâwngchal chu an that a, naupang chu Eli kuoma chun an ṭhuoi a.

en: And she said, Oh, my lord, as thy soul liveth, my lord, I am the woman that stood by thee here, praying unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Aw ka lalpa, i hringna sâlin ka hril a, kei chu aw lalpa, hi hmuna i kâwla ngîr a, LALPA kuoma ṭawngṭaitu nuhmei ka ni ngei a.

en: For this child I prayed; and Jehovah hath given me my petition which I asked of him:
hmr: Hi naupang hni hin ka ṭawngṭai a na, chun, LALPA chun ka hni chu a mi pêk tah a.

en: therefore also I have granted him to Jehovah; as long as he liveth he is granted to Jehovah. And he worshipped Jehovah there.
hmr: Chuleiin, kei khawma LALPA kuomah kân hlân a nih; a dam sûng poa LALPA ta dinga inhlân a nih,” a ta. Chun, chutaka chun LALPA chu a biek a.

en: Then Samuel took the vial of oil, and poured it upon his head, and kissed him, and said, Is it not that Jehovah hath anointed thee to be prince over his inheritance?
hmr: Chuongchun, Samuel chun hriek bâwm chu a hung lâk suok a, a lua chun a bur a, a fâwp a, “LALPA chun a rochan hai chunga hotu dingin hriek a nâl che a ni naw am a nih? LALPA mipuihai chungah ro rêl i ta, an vêla an hmêlmahai kuta inthawkin sandam i tih. Chun, hi hi LALPAIN a rochanhai chunga hotu dingin a ruot che ti inchikna chu ning a tih.

en: When thou art departed from me to-day, then thou shalt find two men by Rachel’s sepulchre, in the border of Benjamin at Zelzah; and they will say unto thee, The asses which thou wentest to seek are found; and, lo, thy father hath left off caring for the asses, and is anxious for you, saying, What shall I do for my son?
hmr: Vawisûn hin i mi fesan hnungin, Zelzaah Benjamin ramria Rakil thlân kâwlah mi pahni hmûng i ta; chun, anni chun i kuomah, Sabengtung i zawnghai kha an hmu tah ie; chun, ngai ta, i pa chun sabengtung chu a ngaituo ta nawh a, nangma mawl a ngaituoh a, ‘Ka naupa chu iengtin am ka thaw ding a ni ta leh aw, a ti a ti el a,’ tîng an ta.

en: Then shalt thou go on forward from thence, and thou shalt come to the oak of Tabor; and there shall meet thee there three men going up to God to Beth-el, one carrying three kids, and another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a bottle of wine:
hmr: Chun, chutaka inthawk chun fe pei la, Tabor thingsaisuo chu va tlung i ta, chutaka chun mi pathum, Bethela Pathien kuoma hang fe dinghaiin lo intuokpui an ti cheh a; pakhat chun kêlte pathum pawm a ta, pakhat chun beiphêk pathum chawi a ta, chun, pakhat chun uoin peng chawi bawk a tih.

en: and they will salute thee, and give thee two loaves of bread, which thou shalt receive of their hand.
hmr: Chun, chibai bûk an ti cheh a, beiphêk chu phêk hni pêng an ti cheh a; chu chu lâng i ta.

en: After that thou shalt come to the hill of God, where is the garrison of the Philistines: and it shall come to pass, when thou art come thither to the city, that thou shalt meet a band of prophets coming down from the high place with a psaltery, and a timbrel, and a pipe, and a harp, before them; and they will be prophesying:
hmr: Chu hnunga chun Philistin sipai- hai umna Pathien tlâng chu va tlung i ta, chun, chutaka khuo i va tlung chun zâwlneihai perkhuong dâm, khuongtê dâm, theihle dâm, ṭingṭang dâm chawihai hma ṭhuoia bâwl- hmuna inthawka hung thla intuok- pui i ta; chun, thu hril duol duol an ta;

en: and the Spirit of Jehovah will come mightily upon thee, and thou shalt prophesy with them, and shalt be turned into another man.
hmr: chun, LALPA thlarau nasatakin i chungah hung tlung a ta, nang khawm thu an hril duol duolnaa chun ṭhang vêng i ta, chun, mi danglam daiah inchang el i tih.

en: And let it be, when these signs are come unto thee, that thou do as occasion shall serve thee; for God is with thee.
hmr: Chun, hieng inchiknahai hi i chunga a hung um pha chun thil hung umin a zir ang peiin i thaw ding a nih; Pathien chu i kuomah a um pei sih a.

en: And thou shalt go down before me to Gilgal; and, behold, I will come down unto thee, to offer burnt-offerings, and to sacrifice sacrifices of peace-offerings: seven days shalt thou tarry, till I come unto thee, and show thee what thou shalt do.
hmr: Chun, ka fe hma hin Gilgala chun lo zu fe la, chun, ngai ta, kei khawm pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai le in- remna inthâwinahai inhlân dingin i kuomah hung thlâng ka ta; i kuoma ka hung a, i thaw ding ka hung hril hma che chun ni sari i lo um ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And it was so, that, when he had turned his back to go from Samuel, God gave him another heart: and all those signs came to pass that day.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chu ṭhe dinga a hnungnghat phingleh Pathien chun lungril danglam dai a pêk tah a; chun, chuong inchiknahai po po chu chu ni chun a hung tlung ta vawng a.

en: And when they came thither to the hill, behold, a band of prophets met him; and the Spirit of God came mightily upon him, and he prophesied among them.
hmr: Chuongchun, tlâng chu an hang tlung chun, ngai ta, zâwlneihai chun an intuokpui a; chun LALPA thlarau nasatakin a hung tlung a; thu an hril duol duolnaa chun a ṭhang ve tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when all that knew him beforetime saw that, behold, he prophesied with the prophets, then the people said one to another, What is this that is come unto the son of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets?
hmr: Chun, kha hmaa ama lo hre hlakhaiin zâwlneihai thu hril duol duolnaah a ṭhang ve ti an hriet chun mihai chu an inbiek a, “Kis naupa chunga thil hung um hi ieng am a ni ta leh? Saula khawm chu zâwlneihai lai a ṭhang ve am a ni el tah?” an ta.

en: And one of the same place answered and said, And who is their father? Therefore it became a proverb, Is Saul also among the prophets?
hmr: Chun, a umna khuoa mi pakhatin a dawn a, “An pa chu tu am a ni bîk leh?” an ta. Chuongchun, “Saula khawm chu zâwlnei a ni ve el ta a ni maw chu?” ti chu ṭawngna takah an hmang ta zing a.

en: And when he had made an end of prophesying, he came to the high place.
hmr: Chun, an thu hril duol duolnaa a ṭhang zo chun bâwlhmun chu a tlung tah a.

en: And Saul’s uncle said unto him and to his servant, Whither went ye? And he said, To seek the asses; and when we saw that they were not found, we came to Samuel.
hmr: Chun, Saula pami chun a kuoma le a siehlaw kuoma chun, “Khâwlai am in feh a?” a ta. Chun, ama chun, “Sabengtung kan zawng a nih, chun, kan hmu zo naw phingleh Samuel kuomah kan fe a nih,” a ta.

en: And Saul’s uncle said, Tell me, I pray thee, what Samuel said unto you.
hmr: Saula pami chun, “Samuel chun i kuomah ieng am a na a hril mi hril raw khai,” a ta.

en: And Saul said unto his uncle, He told us plainly that the asses were found. But concerning the matter of the kingdom, whereof Samuel spake, he told him not.
hmr: Saula chun a pami kuoma chun, “Sabengtunghai chu an hmu tah ti a mi hril ngei kha tie,” a ta. Amiruok- chu, ram chungchâng thu Samuelin a hril chu a hril nawh a.

en: And Samuel called the people together unto Jehovah to Mizpah;
hmr: Chuongchun, Samuel chun mi- puihai chu Mizpaa chun LALPA kuomah a ko khâwm a;

en: and he said unto the children of Israel, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, I brought up Israel out of Egypt, and I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all the kingdoms that oppressed you:
hmr: Israel thlahai kuoma chun, “LALPA Israelhai Pathien chun hieng ang hin a ti a nih, ‘Israelhai chu Aiguptaa inthawkin ka ṭhuoi suok a, Aigupta mihai kuta inthawk le, a hnuoisietuhai cheu ram po poa in- thawkin ka sansuok cheu a.

en: but ye have this day rejected your God, who himself saveth you out of all your calamities and your distresses; and ye have said unto him, Nay, but set a king over us. Now therefore present yourselves before Jehovah by your tribes, and by your thousands.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, vawisûn hin in lunginzîngna po po le in rinumna po poa sanhimtu cheu in Pathien ngei chu in dit nawh a, a kuomah, A ni nawh, lal mi siempêk rawh’ in tih a. Chuleiin, tuhin a hnama hnam le a chia chiin LALPA hmaah hung inlang ro,” a ta.

en: So Samuel brought all the tribes of Israel near, and the tribe of Benjamin was taken.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samuel chun Israel chi po po chu a hung inlangtir a, chun, Benjamin chi chu thlang a lo ni tah a.

en: And he brought the tribe of Benjamin near by their families; and the family of the Matrites was taken; and Saul the son of Kish was taken: but when they sought him, he could not be found.
hmr: Chun, Benjamin chihai chu a sûngkuoin a hung inlangtir a, Matri mi sûngkuo chu thlang an lo ni tah a; chun, Kis naupa Saula chu thlang a lo ni tah a, nisienlakhawm, ama chu an hang zawng a, an hmu nawh a.

en: Therefore they asked of Jehovah further, Is there yet a man to come hither? And Jehovah answered, Behold, he hath hid himself among the baggage.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chu an hang indawn nâwk a, “Mi dang la hung ding an um am?” an ta. Chun, LALPA chun a dawn a, “Ngai ta u, thuomhnaw lai ân bihmang a nih,” a ta.

en: And they ran and fetched him thence; and when he stood among the people, he was higher than any of the people from his shoulders and upward.
hmr: Chuongchun, an tlân a, an va ṭhuoi suok a; chun, mipui lai a hang ngîr chun mi lai chun ân sâng tak el a, mi dang hrim hrim a liengko nêka insâng khawm an um nawh a.

en: And Samuel said to all the people, See ye him whom Jehovah hath chosen, that there is none like him among all the people? And all the people shouted, and said, Long live the king.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun mi po po kuomah, “LALPA mi ruot hi in hmu am? Mipuihai po po lai ama ang hrim hrim an um nawh,” a ta. Chun, mipuihai chu an khêk a, “Pathienin laltak chu humhim raw se,” an ta.

en: Then Samuel told the people the manner of the kingdom, and wrote it in a book, and laid it up before Jehovah. And Samuel sent all the people away, every man to his house.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samuel chun mi- puihai chu ram umdân ding chu a hril a, lekhabuah a ziek a, LALPA hmaa chun a sieh a. Chun, Samuel chun mipuihai chu mâni in tieng seng ân ṭintir tah a.

en: And Saul also went to his house to Gibeah; and there went with him the host, whose hearts God had touched.
hmr: Saula khawm chu Gibea khuoha a in tieng a fe tah a; mi huoisenhai, an lungril Pathienin a tâwkhai, chu a kuomah an fe veh a.

en: But certain worthless fellows said, How shall this man save us? And they despised him, and brought him no present. But he held his peace.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Belial nauhai tu- haiin amani ruok chun, “Hi mipa hin iengtin am mi sandam thei hlak a ta?” an ta. Chuongchun, ama chu an ngainêp a, thilpêk hrim hrim an pêk nuom nawh a. Nisienlakhawm, ama chu a to zing a.

en: Then Nahash the Ammonite came up, and encamped against Jabesh-gilead: and all the men of Jabesh said unto Nahash, Make a covenant with us, and we will serve thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ammon mi Nahas chu a hung inthawk a, Jabes-Gilead thaw tumin a hang ep a; chun, Jabes mihai po po chun Nahas kuoma chun, “Kan kuomah thu thlung la, chuongchun, i rawng bâwl kan tih,” an ta.

en: And Nahash the Ammonite said unto them, On this condition will I make it with you, that all your right eyes be put out; and I will lay it for a reproach upon all Israel.
hmr: Ammon mi Nahas chun an kuomah, “Hieng ang hin a nih in kuoma thu ka thlung ding chu; in mit changtieng po po kheldawk vawng ding nîng a ta, chu chu Israel mi po pohai ta dinga hmingsietna nîng a tih,” a ta.

en: And the elders of Jabesh said unto him, Give us seven days’ respite, that we may send messengers unto all the borders of Israel; and then, if there be none to save us, we will come out to thee.
hmr: Chun, Jabes khuoa upahai chun a kuomah, “Israel ram po poa mi kan hang tir theina dingin ni sari mi la ngai phawt rawh; chutaka a mi sandam ding tukhawm an um naw chun i kuomah hung suok el kan tih,” an ta.

en: Then came the messengers to Gibeah of Saul, and spake these words in the ears of the people: and all the people lifted up their voice, and wept.
hmr: Chuongchun, an mi tirhai chun Saula umna Gibea chu an hung tlung a, mipuihai na hrieta chun chuong thu chu an hril a, chun, mipuihai chun an râwl an insuoh a, an ṭap a.

en: And, behold, Saul came following the oxen out of the field; and Saul said, What aileth the people that they weep? And they told him the words of the men of Jabesh.
hmr: Chun, loa inthawkin Saula chu sebâwng hung khalin a hung a; Saula chun, “Ieng am an ti a na mipuihai chu an ṭap a?” a ta. Chun, Jabes khuoa mihai thuhril chu an hril a.

en: And the Spirit of God came mightily upon Saul when he heard those words, and his anger was kindled greatly.
hmr: Chun, chuong thu chu a hriet phingleh Saula chunga chun Pathien thlarau nasatakin a hung tlung tah a, nasatakin a lung chu a sen ta thut a.

en: And he took a yoke of oxen, and cut them in pieces, and sent them throughout all the borders of Israel by the hand of messengers, saying, Whosoever cometh not forth after Saul and after Samuel, so shall it be done unto his oxen. And the dread of Jehovah fell on the people, and they came out as one man.
hmr: Chuongchun, bâwng tuok khat a that a, a sa chu a chan nawi vawng a, Israel ram po poa chun ân semtir a; “Tukhawm Saula le Samuel hung zui nuom naw taphawt chu an sebâwng chu hieng anga thaw ve hi nîng a tih,” tiin. Chuongchun, mipuihai chun LALPA chu an ṭi tah a, an hung inthawk suok tah a.

en: And he numbered them in Bezek; and the children of Israel were three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand.
hmr: Bezek hmuna chun a tiem a; Israel mihai chu nuoi thum an nih, Juda mihai chu sing thum an na.

en: And they said unto the messengers that came, Thus shall ye say unto the men of Jabesh-gilead, To-morrow, by the time the sun is hot, ye shall have deliverance. And the messengers came and told the men of Jabesh; and they were glad.
hmr: Chun, an mi hung tirhai kuoma chun, “Jabes-Gilead mihai kuoma chun, ‘Zîngah nisa lum vânglai tak hmain sansuok nîng in tih,’ va ti ro,” an ta. Chun, an mi tirhai chu an va feh a, Jabes mihai chu an va hril a: chuongchun, an lâwm ta êm êm a.

en: Therefore the men of Jabesh said, To-morrow we will come out unto you, and ye shall do with us all that seemeth good unto you.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jabes mihai chun, “Zînga hin in kuomah hung suok kan ta, in nuom nuomin kan chunga hin thaw el ro,” an ta.

en: And it was so on the morrow, that Saul put the people in three companies; and they came into the midst of the camp in the morning watch, and smote the Ammonites until the heat of the day: and it came to pass, that they that remained were scattered, so that not two of them were left together.
hmr: Chun, a zînga chun Saula chun mipuihai chu pâwl thumin a siem a; zîng vêng hun lai takin an riekhmuna chun an lût a. Ammon mihai chu sûn nisa sat vânglai tak chenin an that a; an that mahlahai chu an indar vawng a, pahnia um hmunkhat hrim hrim khawm an um dêr nawh a.

en: And the people said unto Samuel, Who is he that said, Shall Saul reign over us? bring the men, that we may put them to death.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chun Samuel kuomah, “Tuhai am an na ‘Saula hin ei chungah ro a rêl el ding am a nih?’ tituhai kha? Chuong mihai chu hung ṭhuoi la lo sukhlum kan tih,” an ta.

en: And Saul said, There shall not a man be put to death this day; for to-day Jehovah hath wrought deliverance in Israel.
hmr: Saula chun, “Vawisûn kher hin chu tukhawm sukhlum ding a ni nawh ie, vawisûn hin LALPA chun Israelhai lai sandamna a hung siem ta sih a,” a ta.

en: Then said Samuel to the people, Come, and let us go to Gilgal, and renew the kingdom there.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun mipuihai kuoma chun, “Hung ro, Gilgala chun fêng ei tiu khai, chutaka chun ram hi indin thar nâwk ei tiu,” a ta.

en: And all the people went to Gilgal; and there they made Saul king before Jehovah in Gilgal; and there they offered sacrifices of peace-offerings before Jehovah; and there Saul and all the men of Israel rejoiced greatly.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipui po po chu Gilgala chun an fe tah a, Saula chu Gilgala chun LALPA hmaah lalah an siem tah a. Chutaka chun LALPA hmaa chun inremna thil- inhlânhai an inhlân a; chuong- chun, chutaka chun Saula le Israel mi po pohai chu an lâwm ta êm êm a.

en: And Samuel said unto all Israel, Behold, I have hearkened unto your voice in all that ye said unto me, and have made a king over you.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun Israel mi po pohai kuoma chun, “Ngai ta u, ka kuoma in thuhrilhai po poa chun in râwl ka ngai a, lal ding chu ka siempêk ta cheu a.

en: And now, behold, the king walketh before you; and I am old and grayheaded; and, behold, my sons are with you: and I have walked before you from my youth unto this day.
hmr: Tuhin, ngai ta u, lal chun a lo keihruoi ta cheu a, kei chu ka hung tarin ka lu khawm ân ṭuok tah a; chun, ngai ta u, ka naupasalhai chu nangni lai an um a, ka tleirâwla inthawkin tu chen hin ka keihruoi cheu a.

en: Here I am: witness against me before Jehovah, and before his anointed: whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or whom have I defrauded? whom have I oppressed? or of whose hand have I taken a ransom to blind mine eyes therewith? and I will restore it you.
hmr: Hitaka hin ka um a, LALPA hmaa le a hrieknâl hmaa hin mi sêl ro le? Tu bâwngchal am ka lâkpêk hlak a? Tu sabengtung am ka lâkpêk hlak a? Tu am ka hlêm ta hlak a? Tu am ka suknawmna hlak a? Ka mit sukdel dingin tu kuoma inthawkin am thamna ka lâk hlak a? Thung nâwk vawng ka ti cheu,” a ta.

en: And they said, Thou hast not defrauded us, nor oppressed us, neither hast thou taken aught of any man’s hand.
hmr: Anni chun, “I mi hlêm ngai nawh a, i mi suknawmna ngai bawk nawh a, tu kuta inthawk khawma lâk âwm lo chu i lâk ngai bawk nawh,” an ta.

en: And he said unto them, Jehovah is witness against you, and his anointed is witness this day, that ye have not found aught in my hand. And they said, He is witness.
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Ka kuta hin âwm naw ieng khawm in hmu nawh ti vawisûn hin LALPA chu nangni laia hretu a nih; a hriek nâl khawm chu hretu a nih,” a ta. Chun, anni chun, “Ama chu hretu a nih,” an ta.

en: And Samuel said unto the people, It is Jehovah that appointed Moses and Aaron, and that brought your fathers up out of the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun mipui kuoma chun, “Mosie le Aron ruottu le Aigupta rama inthawka in puhai ṭhuoi suoktu LALPA chu a nih in sawnnaw.

en: Now therefore stand still, that I may plead with you before Jehovah concerning all the righteous acts of Jehovah, which he did to you and to your fathers.
hmr: Chuongchun, ngîr ṭhap unla, LALPA hmaa hin LALPAIN in chunga le in puhai chunga thil a lo thaw fel dân hang sûtpui ka ti cheu.

en: When Jacob was come into Egypt, and your fathers cried unto Jehovah, then Jehovah sent Moses and Aaron, who brought forth your fathers out of Egypt, and made them to dwell in this place.
hmr: Aigupta rama Jakob a lût hnung khan, in puhai chun LALPA an ko a, chuongchun, LALPA chun Mosie le Aron a tir a, anni chun in puhai chu Aigupta rama inthawkin an ṭhuoi suok a, hi hmuna hin an inumtir tah a.

en: But they forgat Jehovah their God; and he sold them into the hand of Sisera, captain of the host of Hazor, and into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the king of Moab; and they fought against them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, LALPA an Pathien chu an theinghil a; chun, ama chun Hazor sipai hotu Sisera kuta le Philistin mihai kuta le, Moab lal kutah a zawr a, chun, anni chun an do a.

en: And they cried unto Jehovah, and said, We have sinned, because we have forsaken Jehovah, and have served the Baalim and the Ashtaroth: but now deliver us out of the hand of our enemies, and we will serve thee.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chu an ko a, ‘LALPA chu kan nghatsan a, Baalhai, Astarothhai rawng kan bâwl leiin kan lo suol tah a nih; nisienlakhawm, kan hmêlmahai kuta inthawk hin mi sansuok ta la; chuongchun, i rawng- bâwl kan tih,’ an ta.

en: And Jehovah sent Jerubbaal, and Bedan, and Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side; and ye dwelt in safety.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun, Jerubbaal hai, Bedan hai, Jephtha hai, Samuel hai a tir a, in hmêlma khingtieng khingtienga mihai kuta inthawkin a sansuok cheu a, himtakin in um a.

en: And when ye saw that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon came against you, ye said unto me, Nay, but a king shall reign over us; when Jehovah your God was your king.
hmr: Chun, Ammon thlahai lal Nahas chu nangni do dingin a hung ti in hriet phingleh ka kuomah, ‘A ni nawh ie, lalin ro mi rêlpêk raw se,’ in tih a, LALPA Pathien chu in lal a ni zing sih a.

en: Now therefore behold the king whom ye have chosen, and whom ye have asked for: and, behold, Jehovah hath set a king over you.
hmr: Chuleiin, in lal thlang le hni chu en ta u, LALPA chun lal a siempêk ta cheu a ni hi.

en: If ye will fear Jehovah, and serve him, and hearken unto his voice, and not rebel against the commandment of Jehovah, and both ye and also the king that reigneth over you be followers of Jehovah your God, well:
hmr: LALPA chu in ṭih a, a rawng in bâwl a, a râwl in ngai a, LALPA thupêk in helsan nawh a, nangni le in chunga rorêltuhai leh LALPA in Pathien zuituhai in ni chun ṭhang a ta;

en: but if ye will not hearken unto the voice of Jehovah, but rebel against the commandment of Jehovah, then will the hand of Jehovah be against you, as it was against your fathers.
hmr: amiruokchu, LALPA râwl chu ngai loa LALPA thupêk in helsan chun in puhaiin LALPA kut an tuor ang bawkin nangni khawma tuor in tih.

en: Now therefore stand still and see this great thing, which Jehovah will do before your eyes.
hmr: Chuongchun, ngir ṭhap unla, LALPAIN in mithmua thil ropuitak a thaw ding hi lo en ro.

en: Is it not wheat harvest to-day? I will call unto Jehovah, that he may send thunder and rain; and ye shall know and see that your wickedness is great, which ye have done in the sight of Jehovah, in asking you a king.
hmr: Vawisûn hin bu an sîk a ni naw am a nih? Vân inrûmtir ding le ruo insûrtir dingin LALPA chu ko ka ta; chuongchun, lal in hni thua hin LAL- PA mithmua thil in thaw suol hi a nasatzie hi hrein hmûng in tih,” a ta.

en: So Samuel called unto Jehovah; and Jehovah sent thunder and rain that day: and all the people greatly feared Jehovah and Samuel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samuel chun LALPA chu a ko a, LALPA chun chu ni chun vân ân rûmtir a, ruo ân sûrtir tah a; chuongchun, mipui chun LALPA le Samuel chu an ṭi ta êm êm el a.

en: And all the people said unto Samuel, Pray for thy servants unto Jehovah thy God, that we die not; for we have added unto all our sins this evil, to ask us a king.
hmr: Chun, mipui po po chun Samuel kuoma chun, “Kan thi nawna dingin LALPA i Pathien kuoma chun i siehlawhai hi mi ṭawngṭaipêk rawh, hi thil ṭha nawtak, lal kan lo hni hi, kan suol po po belsatu a ni ta hi,” an ta.

en: And Samuel said unto the people, Fear not: ye have indeed done all this evil; yet turn not aside from following Jehovah, but serve Jehovah with all your heart:
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun, mipuihai kuoma chun, “Ṭi naw ro, hi thil ṭha nawtak hi thaw chu in thaw ngei a, amiruokchu, LALPA in zui chun ama chu pêtsan chuong naw unla, in lungril po poin LALPA rawng chu bâwl lem ro;

en: and turn ye not aside; for then would ye go after vain things which cannot profit nor deliver, for they are vain.
hmr: iengkhawma ṭhahnem lo ding le sansuok thei lo ding cheu zuiin pêtsan naw ro, teplo mei mei an ni sih a.

en: For Jehovah will not forsake his people for his great name’s sake, because it hath pleased Jehovah to make you a people unto himself.
hmr: A hming ropuitak lei hin LALPA chun a mihai chu a nghatsan âwm si nawh a, a mihai ni dinga siem cheu chu LALPA lâwm zâwngtak a ni sih a.

en: Moreover as for me, far be it from me that I should sin against Jehovah in ceasing to pray for you: but I will instruct you in the good and the right way.
hmr: Chu chau khawm chu a ni nawh a, in ta dinga ṭawngṭai mah a, LALPA chunga suol chu keia ta ding khawma a âwm naw tawp a nih; lampui ṭha le lampui indik khîkhmu pei lem ka ti cheu.

en: Only fear Jehovah, and serve him in truth with all your heart; for consider how great things he hath done for you.
hmr: LALPA chu ṭi phawt el unla, in lungril po poin titakzetin a rawng bâwl unla, in ta dinga thil a thaw ropuizie hi ngaituo ro khai.

en: But if ye shall still do wickedly, ye shall be consumed, both ye and your king.
hmr: Amiruokchu, suoltaka thil in la thaw rawp chun bohmang in tih, nangni le in lal khawm,” a ta.

en: Saul was forty years old when he began to reign; and when he had reigned two years over Israel,
hmr: Ro a rêl ṭan chun Saula chu kum sâwmthuma upa a na; Israelhai chungah kum hni ro a rêl a.

en: Saul chose him three thousand men of Israel, whereof two thousand were with Saul in Michmash and in the mount of Beth-el, and a thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin: and the rest of the people he sent every man to his tent.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun Israelhai laia mi sâng thum a thlang a, sâng hni chu Mikmasa le Bethel tlângah Saula kuomah an um a; sâng khat chu Benjamin rama Gibeaa Jonathan kuomah an um a; a dang po chu anni puon inah ân fetir vawng a.

en: And Jonathan smote the garrison of the Philistines that was in Geba; and the Philistines heard of it. And Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, Let the Hebrews hear.
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun Gebaa Philistin râl vêngtu sipaihai a thawh a, chu chu Philistin mihai chun an lo hriet a. Chuongchun, Saula chun, “Hebrai mihai khan lo hre seng raw hai seh,” tiin an ram po poah taw- tawrâwt ân mûttir a.

en: And all Israel heard say that Saul had smitten the garrison of the Philistines, and also that Israel was had in abomination with the Philistines. And the people were gathered together after Saul to Gilgal.
hmr: Chun, Israelhai po po chun Saula chun Philistin râl vêngtu sipaihai a thaw ti le Israelhai khawmin Philistin mihai theida an phur a nih ti an lo hriet tah a. Chuongchun, mipuihai chu Gilgala chun Saula kuomah an pungkhâwm ta ṭeu el a.

en: And the Philistines assembled themselves together to fight with Israel, thirty thousand chariots, and six thousand horsemen, and people as the sand which is on the sea-shore in multitude: and they came up, and encamped in Michmash, eastward of Beth-aven.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai chu Israel- hai do ding chun an inpun khâwm ta ṭeu el a, tawlailîr sîng thum, sakawr chung chuong mi sâng ruk, sipai chu tuisuoriet panga phaiphin zât zet an nih; chun, an hang feh a, Beth-aven saktieng panga Mikmasa chun ṭhanghmun an khuor a.

en: When the men of Israel saw that they were in a strait (for the people were distressed), then the people did hide themselves in caves, and in thickets, and in rocks, and in coverts, and in pits.
hmr: Chun, Israel mihai chun hnaw- chêpin an um ti an inhriet chun, (mihai chu an lunginzîng ta hle el a) mihai chu pûka hai, chîmbuka hai, lungpui phêna hai, kula hai, khur sûnga hai an inbih a.

en: Now some of the Hebrews had gone over the Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead; but as for Saul, he was yet in Gilgal, and all the people followed him trembling.
hmr: Hebrai mi ṭhenkhat chu Jordan râla Gad le Gilead rama dâm an tlân a; Saula ruok chu Gilgala chun a la um zing a, mipuihai chun inthin dawr dawr pumin an zui a.

en: And he tarried seven days, according to the set time that Samuel had appointed: but Samuel came not to Gilgal; and the people were scattered from him.
hmr: Samuelin ni a ruot angin ni sari chu a um a, nisienlakhawm, Samuel chu Gilgala chun a la fe ta naw rawp a; chuongchun, mipui chun an tlân dar san tah a.

en: And Saul said, Bring hither the burnt-offering to me, and the peace-offerings. And he offered the burnt-offering.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “Pumraw- hmang thilinhlân ding le inremna thilinhlân dinghai chu hitakah ka kuomah hung la ro,” a ta. Chuong- chun, pumrawhmang thilinhlân chu ân hlân a.

en: And it came to pass that, as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt-offering, behold, Samuel came; and Saul went out to meet him, that he might salute him.
hmr: Chun, pumrawhmang thilin- hlân chu ân hlân zo chaua, ngai ta, Samuel chu a hung tlung tah a; chun, Saula chun chibai bûk dingin ama tuok dingin a feh a.

en: And Samuel said, What hast thou done? And Saul said, Because I saw that the people were scattered from me, and that thou camest not within the days appointed, and that the Philistines assembled themselves together at Michmash;
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun, “Ieng am a ni leh i lo thaw chu?” a ta. Saula chun, “Mipuihai chun an mi fe hmangsan tah a; nang hlak chu ni ruot nia chun i hung tlung ta nawh a; Philistin mihai hlak chu Mikmasa chun an pung- khâwm huk tah ti ka hriet sih a.

en: therefore said I, Now will the Philistines come down upon me to Gilgal, and I have not entreated the favor of Jehovah: I forced myself therefore, and offered the burnt-offering.
hmr: Chuleiin, ‘Philistin mihai chun Gilgala hin an mi hung thaw ding a ni ṭep sih a, LALPA lunginsietna hlak ka la hni si nawh a,’ ka tih a. Chu- leiin, pumrawhmang thilinhlân chu inhlân naw thei ka ni naw a nih,” a ta.

en: And Samuel said to Saul, Thou hast done foolishly; thou hast not kept the commandment of Jehovah thy God, which he commanded thee: for now would Jehovah have established thy kingdom upon Israel for ever.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun Saula kuoma chun, “I thil thaw dân hi ân vêtthlâk ngawt el: LALPA i Pathien thupêk, thu a pêk che hi i zâwm naw a nih; LALPA chun Israelhai chunga în lalna hi kumkhuoa dinga sukdet tum chu a nih a.

en: But now thy kingdom shall not continue: Jehovah hath sought him a man after his own heart, and Jehovah hath appointed him to be prince over his people, because thou hast not kept that which Jehovah commanded thee.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tuhin în lalna chu tâwp tâng a tih; LALPAIN thu a pêk che i zâwm naw leiin LALPA chun ama lungril ang put mi a zawng a, mihai chunga hotu ni dingin LALPAIN a ruot tah a nih,” a ta.

en: And Samuel arose, and gat him up from Gilgal unto Gibeah of Benjamin. And Saul numbered the people that were present with him, about six hundred men.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chu a tho a, Gilgala inthawk chun Benjamin rama Gibea khuoa chun a hang feh a. Chun, Saula chun a kuoma mi umhai chu a tiem a, za ruk lai an na.

en: And Saul, and Jonathan his son, and the people that were present with them, abode in Geba of Benjamin: but the Philistines encamped in Michmash.
hmr: Chun, Saula le a naupa Jona- than le an kuoma mi umhai chu Benjamin rama Geba khuoa chun an um a; nisienlakhawm, Philistin mi- hai chun Mikmasa chun ṭhanghmun an khuor a.

en: And the spoilers came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies: one company turned unto the way that leadeth to Ophrah, unto the land of Shual;
hmr: Chun, râlrûk pâwlhai chu Philistin mihai ṭhanghmuna in- thawkin pâwl thumin an hung suok a; pâwl khat hai chun Shual rama Ophra tieng pan lampui an hrawh a,

en: and another company turned the way to Beth-horon; and another company turned the way of the border that looketh down upon the valley of Zeboim toward the wilderness.
hmr: chun, pâwl khat chun Beth- horon tieng pan lampui an hrawh a; chun, pâwl khat chun thlalêr dep Zeboim ruom tieng ngha ramri lampui chu an hrawh a.

en: Now there was no smith found throughout all the land of Israel; for the Philistines said, Lest the Hebrews make them swords or spears:
hmr: Israel ram pumpuia chun thirsu hrim hrim an um nawh a; Philistin mihai chun, “Hebrai mihai hi kâwl- hnâmhai amanih, feihai amani hi siem hlau rawi an tih,” an ti a nih.

en: but all the Israelites went down to the Philistines, to sharpen every man his share, and his coulter, and his axe, and his mattock;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Israel mihai po po chu bâwngtuthlaw dâm, hmawl hmawra inbûk thîr dâm chu intât- ngeitir dingin Philistin mihai kuom- ah an zu fe hlak a;

en: yet they had a file for the mattocks, and for the coulters, and for the forks, and for the axes, and to set the goads.
hmr: chuong an hnuoi inletna thîr ngei le bâwng tuthlaw tâtna man chu sekel hmun thuma ṭhea hmun hni a na, an hreipui le hmawl hmawra thîr inbûk tât man chu sekel hmun thuma ṭhea hmun khat a nih.

en: So it came to pass in the day of battle, that there was neither sword nor spear found in the hand of any of the people that were with Saul and Jonathan: but with Saul and with Jonathan his son was there found.
hmr: Chuongchun, an indo ni chun Saula le Jonathan kuoma mi umhai chun kâwlhnâm amanih, fei amanih nei hrim hrim an um dêr nawh a; Saula le a naupa Jonathan ruok chun an nei a.

en: And the garrison of the Philistines went out unto the pass of Michmash.
hmr: Chun, Philistin râl vêngtu sipaihai chu Mikmas kâwna chun an suok tah a.

en: Now it fell upon a day, that Jonathan the son of Saul said unto the young man that bare his armor, Come, and let us go over to the Philistines’ garrison, that is on yonder side. But he told not his father.
hmr: Ni khat chu Saula naupa Jonathan chun a râlthuom chawitu tlangvâl kuoma chun, “Hung ta, khingtieng râl Philistin mi râl vêngtu sipaihai umnaa sawn va fêng ei tih,” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, a pa chu a hril nawh a.

en: And Saul abode in the uttermost part of Gibeah under the pomegranate-tree which is in Migron: and the people that were with him were about six hundred men;
hmr: Saula chu Gibea ram hmawr tieng daia Migrona theibufai kûng hnuoiah a um a; a kuoma mi umhai chu za ruk amani lai an na.

en: and Ahijah, the son of Ahitub, Ichabod’s brother, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eli, the priest of Jehovah in Shiloh, wearing an ephod. And the people knew not that Jonathan was gone.
hmr: Chun, Silo khuoa thiempu Eli naupa Phinehas naupa Ikabod naupa Ahitub naupa Ahija chu thiempu zakawsîng hâkin a um veh a. Chun, Jonathan chu a fe ti mipuihai chun an hriet nawh a.

en: And between the passes, by which Jonathan sought to go over unto the Philistines’ garrison, there was a rocky crag on the one side, and a rocky crag on the other side: and the name of the one was Bozez, and the name of the other Seneh.
hmr: Jonathanin Philistin mi râl vêngtu sipaihai umnaa fe a tumna kâwn le kâwn inkâra chun a khingtieng khingtieng chun lungpui indaw a um a, pakhat hming chu Bozez a na, a pakhat hming chu Sene a nih.

en: The one crag rose up on the north in front of Michmash, and the other on the south in front of Geba.
hmr: Lungpui indaw pakhat chu Mikmas hmârtieng panga um a na, a dang pakhat chu Geba zâwn simtieng panga um a nih.

en: And Jonathan said to the young man that bare his armor, Come, and let us go over unto the garrison of these uncircumcised: it may be that Jehovah will work for us; for there is no restraint to Jehovah to save by many or by few.
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun, a râl- thuom chawitu tlangvâl kuoma chun, “Hung rawh, sertan lo sipaihai umnaa sawn va fêng ei tih; LALPA chun thil a mi thawpêk khiet rawi mawh; LALPA ta ding chun a tam amanih, a tlâwm amaniha sandam chu ieng- khawm a thei nawna a um chuong si nawh a,” a ta.

en: And his armorbearer said unto him, Do all that is in thy heart: turn thee, behold, I am with thee according to thy heart.
hmr: Chun, a râlthuom chawitu chun a kuomah, “I lungrila um angtak chun thaw rawh, ngai ta, i lungril angtak chu ka lungril a nih,” a ta.

en: Then said Jonathan, Behold, we will pass over unto the men, and we will disclose ourselves unto them.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jonathan chun “Hung ta, an kuoma sawn va kai ei ta, vân suklang ei tih.

en: If they say thus unto us, Tarry until we come to you; then we will stand still in our place, and will not go up unto them.
hmr: Chun, ei kuomah, ‘In kuoma kan hung hmakhat chun la um ro,’ an mi ti chun, ei hmuna chun ngîr zing ei ta,an kuomah hang fe nâwng ei ta,

en: But if they say thus, Come up unto us; then we will go up; for Jehovah hath delivered them into our hand: and this shall be the sign unto us.
hmr: ‘Kan kuom tieng hin hung ro,’ an ti ruok chun hang fêng ei ta, LALPAIN ei kutah a mi pêk a ni tah ti inchikna ning a tih,” a ta.

en: And both of them disclosed themselves unto the garrison of the Philistines: and the Philistines said, Behold, the Hebrews come forth out of the holes where they had hid themselves.
hmr: Chun, an pahni chun Philistin mi râl vêngtu sipaihai hmuna chun an vân suklang a, chun, Philistin mihai chun, “En ta u, Hebrai mihai an inbîkna khursûnga inthawkin an hung suok tah,” an ta.

en: And the men of the garrison answered Jonathan and his armorbearer, and said, Come up to us, and we will show you a thing. And Jonathan said unto his armorbearer, Come up after me; for Jehovah hath delivered them into the hand of Israel.
hmr: Chun, râl vêngtu sipaihai umnaa mihai chun Jonathan le a râlthuom chawitu chu, “Hung unla, thil ieng amanih lo inentir kan ti cheu,” tiin an lo ko a. Chun, Jonathan chun a râlthuom chawitu kuoma chun, “Mi hung zui raw khai, LALPA chun anni chu Israelhai kutah a pêk tah a nih,” a ta.

en: And Jonathan climbed up upon his hands and upon his feet, and his armorbearer after him: and they fell before Jonathan; and his armorbearer slew them after him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jonathan chu a kut le a ke hmangin a hang lâwn a, a râlthuom chawitu chun a zui a; chun, anni chu Jonathan hmaa chun an tlu ta zawt zawt a, a râlthuom chawitu chun a hung that ve pei a.

en: And that first slaughter, which Jonathan and his armorbearer made, was about twenty men, within as it were half a furrow’s length in an acre of land.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jonathan le a râlthuom chawituin an that hmasa tak ṭum chun ṭin chenve hmun ding ang vêla hin mi sâwmhni amani lai an that a nih.

en: And there was a trembling in the camp, in the field, and among all the people; the garrison, and the spoilers, they also trembled; and the earth quaked: so there was an exceeding great trembling.
hmr: Chun, riekhmuna mihai, phûla mi dâm, mipuihai po po chu an inthin a; chun, râl vêngtu sipaihai le râlrûkhai khawm chu an inthin veh a, chun, simkhawleihnuoi ân hning a, nasataka inthinna a um a.

en: And the watchmen of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked; and, behold, the multitude melted away, and they went hither and thither.
hmr: Chun, Benjamin ram Gibeaa Saula râl vêngtuhai chun an hang thlîr vêl a, ngai ta, mipuihai chu an ṭe dar hum hum a, khingtieng khing- tiengah an invâk nuoi nuoi el a.

en: Then said Saul unto the people that were with him, Number now, and see who is gone from us. And when they had numbered, behold, Jonathan and his armorbearer were not there.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chun a kuoma mipui umhai kuoma chun, “Tuhin intiem unla, tuhai hai am an na a kim naw?” a ta. Chun, an hang intiem chun ngai ta, Jonathan le a râlthuom chawitu chu an lo um ve ta nawh a.

en: And Saul said unto Ahijah, Bring hither the ark of God. For the ark of God was there at that time with the children of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun Ahija kuoma chun, “Pathien bâwm chu hang la raw khai,” a tih a. Chuong lai chun Pathien bâwm chu Israel thlahai laia um a na.

en: And it came to pass, while Saul talked unto the priest, that the tumult that was in the camp of the Philistines went on and increased: and Saul said unto the priest, Withdraw thy hand.
hmr: Chun, hieng hi a hung na, Saulân thiempu a biek zing lai dâm chun Philistin mihai riekhmun tienga buoi mur mur chu a zuol ta deu deu a; Saula chun thiempu kuoma chun, “I kut la kîr rawh,” a ta.

en: And Saul and all the people that were with him were gathered together, and came to the battle: and, behold, every man’s sword was against his fellow, and there was a very great discomfiture.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula le mipuihai po po chu an fe khâwm a, indonaa chun an fe tah a; chun, anni le anni kâwlhnâma lo inthaw rak a, lo buoi nuk nuk chu an hmu a.

en: Now the Hebrews that were with the Philistines as beforetime, and that went up with them into the camp, from the country round about, even they also turned to be with the Israelites that were with Saul and Jonathan.
hmr: Chuongchun, chuong lai ram vêla mi riekhmuna hang fe ve, kha hma tienga Philistin mihai kuoma ṭhang Hebrai mihai khawm chu Saula le Jonathan kuoma um Israel mihai kuoma chun an hung ṭhang ve tah a.

en: Likewise all the men of Israel that had hid themselves in the hill-country of Ephraim, when they heard that the Philistines fled, even they also followed hard after them in the battle.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin Ephraim tlâng rama Israel mi inbihmang po pohai khawm khan Philistin mihai an tlânhmang ti an lo hriet a, anni khawm chun indonaa chun ṭhangin an hnawt zui ve ta ngat ngat a.

en: So Jehovah saved Israel that day: and the battle passed over by Beth-aven.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPAIN chu ni chun Israel mihai chu a sanhim tah a, chun, Beth-aven tlung rakin an thawh a.

en: And the men of Israel were distressed that day; for Saul had adjured the people, saying, Cursed be the man that eateth any food until it be evening, and I be avenged on mine enemies. So none of the people tasted food.
hmr: Chun, chu ni chun Israel mihai chu an lunginzîng a; nisienlakhawm, Saula chun, “Ka hmêlmahai chunga phuba ka lâk a, khuo a hung inhnu hmaa tukhawma bu a fâk chun ṭawng-sephurin um raw se,” tiin mi- pui chu a vau a. Chuongchun, tu- khawma bu chu intem khawm an intem dêr nawh a.

en: And all the people came into the forest; and there was honey upon the ground.
hmr: Chun, mipui po pohai chun ramhnuoi an va tlung a, hnuoia chun khuoizu dâm a lo um a.

en: And when the people were come unto the forest, behold, the honey dropped: but no man put his hand to his mouth; for the people feared the oath.
hmr: Chun, mipuiin ramhnuoi an va tlung chun khuoizu dâm a lo luong a, nisienlakhawm, tukhawma an liek nawh, mipuihai chun inkhâmna chu an ṭi a nih.

en: But Jonathan heard not when his father charged the people with the oath: wherefore he put forth the end of the rod that was in his hand, and dipped it in the honeycomb, and put his hand to his mouth; and his eyes were enlightened.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Jonathan chu a pa chun mipuihai chu inkhâma a vau lai a hriet ve nawh a; chuongchun a hmawl chawi hmawr chu khuoi- thlâra chun a sunphûm a, a liek a, chuongchun, a mit meng chu a hung fie tah a.

en: Then answered one of the people, and said, Thy father straitly charged the people with an oath, saying, Cursed be the man that eateth food this day. And the people were faint.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipui laia mi pakhat chun a lo dawn a, “I pa chun mipuihai hi, ‘Vawisûna bu fa taphawt chu ṭawngsephurin um raw se,’ tiin a mi vau tlat a, mipuihai khawm an chau hle hrim a,” a ta.

en: Then said Jonathan, My father hath troubled the land: see, I pray you, how mine eyes have been enlightened, because I tasted a little of this honey.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jonathan chun, “Ka pa hin mihai a suklunginzing el a ni hi maw, en ta unla, khuoizu tlâwmte ka hang intem lei chauin ka mit meng a fie tâkzie hi.

en: How much more, if haply the people had eaten freely to-day of the spoil of their enemies which they found? for now hath there been no great slaughter among the Philistines.
hmr: Mipui hin an râllâk thil an hmu taphawt vawisûn hin an nuom nuomin fa thei hai sienla lem chu a va nasa nâwkzuol âwm de! chu lei tak chun Philistin mihai chu ei that nasa thei naw pha a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And they smote of the Philistines that day from Michmash to Aijalon. And the people were very faint;
hmr: Chuongchun, chu ni chun Mikmasa inthawkin Aijalon chenin Philistin mihai chu an thawh a; chun, mipuihai chu an châu hle el tah a.

en: and the people flew upon the spoil, and took sheep, and oxen, and calves, and slew them on the ground; and the people did eat them with the blood.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipuihai chun an râllâk thilhai chu a bawin an bawh a, berâmhai, bâwngchalhai, kêltehai an man a, hnuoia chun an sukhlum a, mipuihai chun a thisen pumin an fâk el tah a.

en: Then they told Saul, saying, Behold, the people sin against Jehovah, in that they eat with the blood. And he said, Ye have dealt treacherously: roll a great stone unto me this day.
hmr: Chuongchun, “Ngai ta, mipui- hai chun thisen puma fain LALPA chungah thil an suksuol tah,” tiin, Saula chu an hril a. Chun, ama chun, “Ringmawumtakin thil in thaw a nih, lung lientak mi hung inhlumpêk ro,” a ta.

en: And Saul said, Disperse yourselves among the people, and say unto them, Bring me hither every man his ox, and every man his sheep, and slay them here, and eat; and sin not against Jehovah in eating with the blood. And all the people brought every man his ox with him that night, and slew them there.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “Mipuihai lai chun invâk dar vawng unla, an kuomah, ‘Mi tinin a sebâwng le berâm ka kuomah hung la sienla, hitaka hin hung that sienla, fa raw se, a thisen puma faa LALPA chunga thil suksuol loin, a tih,’ va ti ro khai,” a ta. Chun, chu zân chun mi po po chun mâni bâwngchal an hung kei seng a, chutaka chun an that a.

en: And Saul built an altar unto Jehovah: the same was the first altar that he built unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun LALPA ta dingin mâichâm a siem a, chu chu LALPA ta dinga mâichâm siem hmasa tak a nih.

en: And Saul said, Let us go down after the Philistines by night, and take spoil among them until the morning light, and let us not leave a man of them. And they said, Do whatsoever seemeth good unto thee. Then said the priest, Let us draw near hither unto God.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “Zânah Philistin mihai chu zu thaw inla, zîng khawvar chenin rawk ei tiu khai, tukhawm hla hrim hrim nâwng ei tiu,” a ta. Chun, anni chun, “Ṭha i ti ang angin thaw rawh,” an ta. Thiem- pu ruok chun, “Hi lai hin Pathien hnai phawt ei tiu khai,” a ta.

en: And Saul asked counsel of God, Shall I go down after the Philistines? wilt thou deliver them into the hand of Israel? But he answered him not that day.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun Pathien a râwn a, “Philistin mihai chu ka zu thaw ding am a nih? Israelhai kutah i pêk ding am a nih?” a ta. Nisienla- khawm, chu ni chun a dawn nawh a.

en: And Saul said, Draw nigh hither, all ye chiefs of the people; and know and see wherein this sin hath been this day.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “Nangni mipui hotuhai po po kha hung hnai ta u khai, vawisûn hin a ieng tak am ei thaw suol a na ti hriet tum ei tiu khai.

en: For, as Jehovah liveth, who saveth Israel, though it be in Jonathan my son, he shall surely die. But there was not a man among all the people that answered him.
hmr: Israelhai sandam hlaktu LAL- PA hringna sâlin ka hril a nih, ka naupa Jonathan thilthawa khawm lo ni a ni chun a thi ngei ngei ding a nih,” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, mipui laia mi chun tukhawm a dawn hrim hrim an um nawh a.

en: Then said he unto all Israel, Be ye on one side, and I and Jonathan my son will be on the other side. And the people said unto Saul, Do what seemeth good unto thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israelhai po po kuoma chun, “Nangni hi a tumin um khâwm unla; chun, kei le ka naupa Jonathan hi a tumin um kan tih,” a ta. Chun, mipuihai chun Saula kuomah, “Ṭha i ti ang angin thaw rawh,” an ta.

en: Therefore Saul said unto Jehovah, the God of Israel, Show the right. And Jonathan and Saul were taken by lot; but the people escaped.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chun LAL- PA Israelhai Pathien kuoma chun, “Ân diktak chu hung suklang rawh,” a ta; chun, aisan chu Jonathan le Saula chunga chun a tluh a, mipuihai ruok chu an fihlim a.

en: And Saul said, Cast lots between me and Jonathan my son. And Jonathan was taken.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “Kei le ka naupa Jonathan hriet ṭhena dingin aisân ro,” a ta.

en: Then Saul said to Jonathan, Tell me what thou hast done. And Jonathan told him, and said, I did certainly taste a little honey with the end of the rod that was in my hand; and, lo, I must die.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jonathan chunga chun a tlu tah a. Chun, Saula chun Jonathan kuoma chun, “Iengam a na i thaw mi hril raw khai?” a ta. Chun, Jonathan chun a hril a, “Ka hmawl chawi hmawrin khuoizu tlâwmte chu kân tem ngei el a, ngai ta, ka thi ngei ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And Saul said, God do so and more also; for thou shalt surely die, Jonathan.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “Pathien chun a thaw thawin thaw el sienla, chu nêka nasa khawma, i thi ngei ding a nih, Jonathan,” a ta.

en: And the people said unto Saul, Shall Jonathan die, who hath wrought this great salvation in Israel? Far from it: as Jehovah liveth, there shall not one hair of his head fall to the ground; for he hath wrought with God this day. So the people rescued Jonathan, that he died not.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chun Saula kuoma chun, “Israelhai laia hi san- damna ropuitak thawtu Jonathan hi a thi el ding maw? Teu lo e, LALPA hringna sâlin kan hril a nih, a sam zai khat khawm hi hnuoia tla hlek naw nih; vawisûn hin Pathien sin a thaw- pui a ni sih a,” an ta. Chuongchun, mipui chun Jonathan chu thi lo dingin an sanhim tah a.

en: Then Saul went up from following the Philistines; and the Philistines went to their own place.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saulan Philistin mihai a hnawt chu a kîrsan tah a; chun, Philistin mihai khawm chu anni umna hmunah an fe tah a.

en: Now when Saul had taken the kingdom over Israel, he fought against all his enemies on every side, against Moab, and against the children of Ammon, and against Edom, and against the kings of Zobah, and against the Philistines: and whithersoever he turned himself, he put them to the worse.
hmr: Saula chu Israelhai chunga rorêltua a hang ṭhang chun kil tina a hmêlma, Moab mihai, Ammon thla- hai, Edom mihai, Zoba lalhai dâm, Philistin mihai chu a do a; ân herna tienga taphawt chu a hne pei el a.

en: And he did valiantly, and smote the Amalekites, and delivered Israel out of the hands of them that despoiled them.
hmr: Huoitakin a thawh a, Amalek mihai chu a hneh a, Israel mihai chu anni rawk hlaktuhai kuta inthawkin a sansuok a nih.

en: Now the sons of Saul were Jonathan, and Ishvi, and Malchishua; and the names of his two daughters were these: the name of the first-born Merab, and the name of the younger Michal:
hmr: Saula naupasalhai chu Jona- than hai, Isvi hai, Malkisua hai an na, chun a naunuhmei pahnihai hming chu hieng hi a nih: a upa lem hming chu Merab a na, a naupang lem hming chu Mikal a nih.

en: and the name of Saul’s wife was Ahinoam the daughter of Ahimaaz. And the name of the captain of his host was Abner the son of Ner, Saul’s uncle.
hmr: Saula nuhmei hming chu Ahinoam, Ahimaaz naunu a nih. A sipai hotuhai hming chu Abner, Saula pami Nera naupa a nih.

en: And Kish was the father of Saul; and Ner the father of Abner was the son of Abiel.
hmr: Kis chu Saula pa a na, chun, Abner pa Nera chu Abiel naupa a nih.

en: And there was sore war against the Philistines all the days of Saul: and when Saul saw any mighty man, or any valiant man, he took him unto him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula dam sûng po po chun Philistin mihai le hin nasatakin an indo hlak a; chun, Saula chun mi hrât amanih, mi huoi amanih a hmu taphawt chu a lâk pei hlak a nih.

en: And Samuel said unto Saul, Jehovah sent me to anoint thee to be king over his people, over Israel: now therefore hearken thou unto the voice of the words of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun Saula kuomah, “LALPAIN a mihai chungah, Israelhai chunga lal dinga hriek nâl ding chein a mi tir a nih; chuongchun, LALPA thuhril râwl chu ngai ta khai, Sipaihai LALPA chun.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, I have marked that which Amalek did to Israel, how he set himself against him in the way, when he came up out of Egypt.
hmr: ‘Amalek mihai Israelhai chunga an thilthaw Aigupta rama inthawka an hung suok laia an lo dodâl dân dâm kha kân chik zing a.

en: Now go and smite Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them not; but slay both man and woman, infant and suckling, ox and sheep, camel and ass.
hmr: Amalek mihai do dingin fe la, an thil nei po po hla hrim hrim nei dêr loin sukbohmang vawng rawh; nu- hmei le pasal, naute khawm, nêne ne laihai dâm, bâwngchal le berâm dâm, sanghâwngsei le sabengtung dâm leh sukhlum vawng rawh,’ a ti a nih,” a ta.

en: And Saul summoned the people, and numbered them in Telaim, two hundred thousand footmen, and ten thousand men of Judah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chun mi- puihai chu a ko khâwm a. Telaim khuoa chun a tiem a, sipai nuoi hni le Juda mi sîng khat an nih.

en: And Saul came to the city of Amalek, and laid wait in the valley.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun Amalek mihai khuo chu a zu tlung a, ruoma chun a lo lambun a.

en: And Saul said unto the Kenites, Go, depart, get you down from among the Amalekites, lest I destroy you with them; for ye showed kindness to all the children of Israel, when they came up out of Egypt. So the Kenites departed from among the Amalekites.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun Ken mihai kuoma chun, “Hung suok unla, Amalek mihai laia inthawk hin insie fihlîm ro, chuong naw chun sukhlum sa rawi ka ti cheu, nangni chun chu Israel thlahai po po Aigupta rama inthawka an hung suok khan in lo lunginsiet sih a,” a ta. Chuongchun, Ken mihai chu Amalek mihai laia inthawk chun an suok tah a.

en: And Saul smote the Amalekites, from Havilah as thou goest to Shur, that is before Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun Amalek mihai chu Havilaa inthawka Aigupta ram dep Sur chenin a thawh a.

en: And he took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive, and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword.
hmr: Chun, Amalek mihai lal Agag chu a hringin a man a, mipuihai po po chu kâwlhnâmin a sât hlum vawng a.

en: But Saul and the people spared Agag, and the best of the sheep, and of the oxen, and of the fatlings, and the lambs, and all that was good, and would not utterly destroy them: but everything that was vile and refuse, that they destroyed utterly.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Saula le mipuihai chun Agag chu an hlah a, berâm ṭha ṭhahai, bâwngchal ṭha ṭhahai, a thau thau dâm, berâmte le a ṭha po po leh, chuonghai chu an sukhlum nuom nawh a; a ṭha naw le an dit naw po chu an sukhlum vawng a.

en: Then came the word of Jehovah unto Samuel, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu Samuel kuoma chun a hung tlung a.

en: It repenteth me that I have set up Saul to be king; for he is turned back from following me, and hath not performed my commandments. And Samuel was wroth; and he cried unto Jehovah all night.
hmr: “Saula hi lala ka ruot hi kân sîr ngawt el a nih; a mi zui lai chu a mi hnung innghatin ka thupêk angin a thaw si nawh a,” a ta. Chun, Samuel chu a lunginsen a, zânkhawvârin LALPA chu a ko a.

en: And Samuel rose early to meet Saul in the morning; and it was told Samuel, saying, Saul came to Carmel, and, behold, he set him up a monument, and turned, and passed on, and went down to Gilgal.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chu Saula tuok dingin zîngkâr chun a tho a, chun, “Saula chu Karmelah a feh a, ngai ta, chutaka chun hriet zingna lung a phun a; chun, a kir nâwk a, a fe pei a, Gilgala chun a zu fe tah,” tiin Samuel chu an hril a.

en: And Samuel came to Saul; and Saul said unto him, Blessed be thou of Jehovah: I have performed the commandment of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chu Saula kuom tieng chun a fe tah a; chun, Saula chun a kuomah, “LALPAIN malsâwm raw se che, LALPA thupêk ang chun ka thaw tah,” a ta.

en: And Samuel said, What meaneth then this bleating of the sheep in mine ears, and the lowing of the oxen which I hear?
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun, “Chuong berâm inbe ka naa hung lût le, bâwngchal inbu ka hang hriet si chu iengtizie am a na?” a ta.

en: And Saul said, They have brought them from the Amalekites: for the people spared the best of the sheep and of the oxen, to sacrifice unto Jehovah thy God; and the rest we have utterly destroyed.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “Amalek mihai ta an hung lâkpêk a nih, LALPA i Pathien kuoma inthâwina dingin mipuihaiin berâm ṭha ṭhahai le, bâwngchal ṭha an hla a nih, chun a dang po po chu kan sukhlum vawng a nih,” a ta.

en: Then Samuel said unto Saul, Stay, and I will tell thee what Jehovah hath said to me this night. And he said unto him, Say on.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun Saula kuomah, “Ngai rawh, zâni zâna LALPAIN thu ka kuoma a hril, hril ka ti che,” a ta. Ama chun a kuomah, “Hril raw khai,” a ta.

en: And Samuel said, Though thou wast little in thine own sight, wast thou not made the head of the tribes of Israel? And Jehovah anointed thee king over Israel;
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun, “Nanga ngaia chun mi chîntak ni la khawm, Israelhai hotu dinga siem i ni a ni naw am a nih? Chun, LALPA chun Israelhai lal dingin hriek a nâl cheh a;

en: and Jehovah sent thee on a journey, and said, Go, and utterly destroy the sinners the Amalekites, and fight against them until they be consumed.
hmr: chun, LALPA chun a tir suok cheh a. ‘Fe la, mi suolhai, Amalek mihai chu sukhlum vawng la, an bohmang dêr hmakhat chun thaw pei rawh,’ a ti cheh a.

en: Wherefore then didst thou not obey the voice of Jehovah, but didst fly upon the spoil, and didst that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah?
hmr: Iengdinga LALPA thu chu zâwm lo a, râllâk thil chu a bawa i bawh a, LALPA mithmua thil ṭha naw i thaw el am?” a ta.

en: And Saul said unto Samuel, Yea, I have obeyed the voice of Jehovah, and have gone the way which Jehovah sent me, and have brought Agag the king of Amalek, and have utterly destroyed the Amalekites.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun Samuel kuomah, “E, LALPA thu ka zâwm annâwm, LALPA mi tirna tienga chun ka feh a; Amalek lal Agag ka hung man a, Amalek mihai chu ka sukhlum vawng annâwm.

en: But the people took of the spoil, sheep and oxen, the chief of the devoted things, to sacrifice unto Jehovah thy God in Gilgal.
hmr: Amiruokchu, mipuihai chun râllâk thil berâm le bâwngchalhai sukbohmang ding laia a ṭha ṭhahai chu Gilgal khuoa LALPA i Pathien kuoma inthâwina dingin an hung lâk a nih,” a ta.

en: And Samuel said, Hath Jehovah as great delight in burnt-offerings and sacrifices, as in obeying the voice of Jehovah? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, and to hearken than the fat of rams.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun, “LALPA chun LALPA thu zâwm chu a lâwm angin pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai le inthâwinahai hi a lâwm am a nih? Ngai ta, inthâwina nêkin thuawi chu a ṭha lem a, berâmchal thau nêkin a thu pawm chu a ṭha lem a nih.

en: For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, and stubbornness is as idolatry and teraphim. Because thou hast rejected the word of Jehovah, he hath also rejected thee from being king.
hmr: Helna hi aisan thiemna suolhai leh ân ang a, kawmâwna hi milim biek le rîtlona suol tluk a nih. LALPA thu i dit naw leiin ama khawma lal dingin a dit bîk ta naw che a nih,” a ta.

en: And Saul said unto Samuel, I have sinned; for I have transgressed the commandment of Jehovah, and thy words, because I feared the people, and obeyed their voice.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun Samuel kuoma chun, “Thil ka suksuol dêr a ni chu, LALPA thupêk le i thu chu ka lo bawsiet a ni zing chu tie; mipuihai ka ṭia an râwl ka lo ngai leiin.

en: Now therefore, I pray thee, pardon my sin, and turn again with me, that I may worship Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka suol chu ngaidam la, LALPA ka biek theina dingin mi fepui nâwk rawh,” a ta.

en: And Samuel said unto Saul, I will not return with thee; for thou hast rejected the word of Jehovah, and Jehovah hath rejected thee from being king over Israel.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun Saula kuomah, “Fepui naw tawp ka ti che, LALPA thu chu i dit si nawh a; chun, LALPA khawmin Israelhai lal dingin a dit bîk ta naw che a nih,” a ta.

en: And as Samuel turned about to go away, Saul laid hold upon the skirt of his robe, and it rent.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samuel chu fe dinga a hang inher chun a puon hmawr chu a chel a, a tlêr tah a.

en: And Samuel said unto him, Jehovah hath rent the kingdom of Israel from thee this day, and hath given it to a neighbor of thine, that is better than thou.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun a kuomah, “Vawisûna inthawk hin LALPA chun Israel ram hi a lâkpêk ta cheh a, i nêka ṭha lem i tuolbâwm a pêk tah a nih.

en: And also the Strength of Israel will not lie nor repent; for he is not a man, that he should repent.
hmr: Chun, Israelhai Thahrui chu inkhêl naw nih a, inkîr bawk naw nih; mihriem anga inkîr nâwk el mi a ni nawh a,” a ta.

en: Then he said, I have sinned: yet honor me now, I pray thee, before the elders of my people, and before Israel, and turn again with me, that I may worship Jehovah thy God.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chun, “Ka lo suol a ni tah a, nisienlakhawm, ka mihai upa le, Israelhai hmaa hin mi chawimawi dingin ka ngên che a nih; chun, LALPA i Pathien ka biek theina dingin mi fepui hrâm bawk la,” a ta.

en: So Samuel turned again after Saul; and Saul worshipped Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samuel chun Saula chu a fepui tah a; Saula chun LALPA chu a biek tah a.

en: Then said Samuel, Bring ye hither to me Agag the king of the Amalekites. And Agag came unto him cheerfully. And Agag said, Surely the bitterness of death is past.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun, “Amalek mihai lal Agag chu ka kuomah hung ṭhuoi ro,” a tih a. Chuongchun, Agag chu a kuoma chun inthin pumin a va feh a. Chun, Agag chun, “Thina kha chu ka pumpel ta chu ni âwmtak a na,” a ta.

en: And Samuel said, As thy sword hath made women childless, so shall thy mother be childless among women. And Samuel hewed Agag in pieces before Jehovah in Gilgal.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun, “I kâwl- hnâmin nuhmeihai nau boa a siem angin i nu khawm nuhmei laia nau bo mi nîng a tih,” a ta. Chuongchun, Samuel chun Agag chu Gilgal khuoa chun LALPA hmaah a sât nawi neng el tah a.

en: Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to his house to Gibeah of Saul.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chu Rama khuo- ah a feh a; chun, Saula chu a umna khuo Gibeaa chun a hang fe tah a.

en: And Samuel came no more to see Saul until the day of his death; for Samuel mourned for Saul: and Jehovah repented that he had made Saul king over Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samuel chun a thi ni chenin Saula chu a sir nâwk ta nawh a; amiruokchu, Samuel chu Saula leiin a lungngai a nih; chun, LALPA khawm chu Israelhai lal dinga Saula a lo siem chu ân sîr a nih.

en: And Jehovah said unto Samuel, How long wilt thou mourn for Saul, seeing I have rejected him from being king over Israel? fill thy horn with oil, and go: I will send thee to Jesse the Beth-lehemite; for I have provided me a king among his sons.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Samuel kuomah, “Israel mihai lal dinga ka dit ta naw hnung chu Saula lei hin ieng chen am i lungngai ding a ni leh? I kiah hriek thun sip la, fe rawh; Bethlehem mi Jesai kuomah ka tir ding che a nih, a naupasalhai laia mi lal dingin ka ruot zing tah a nih,” a ta.

en: And Samuel said, How can I go? if Saul hear it, he will kill me. And Jehovah said, Take a heifer with thee, and say, I am come to sacrifice to Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun, “Iengtin am fe thei ka ti leh? Saula chun a lo hriet chun mi sukhlum el a tih,” a ta. Chun, LALPA chun, “Bâwngla ṭhuoi la, ‘LALPA kuoma inthâwi dinga hung ka nih,’ ti el rawh.

en: And call Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will show thee what thou shalt do: and thou shalt anoint unto me him whom I name unto thee.
hmr: Chun, inthâwinaa chun Jesai chu ko la; chun, i thaw ding chu hril ka ti cheh a; chun, a hming ka hril ding che chu hriek mi nâlpêk rawh,” a ta.

en: And Samuel did that which Jehovah spake, and came to Beth-lehem. And the elders of the city came to meet him trembling, and said, Comest thou peaceably?
hmr: Chuongchun, Samuel chun LALPA hril ang chun a thaw a, Bethlehema chun a fe tah a. Khuoa upahai chun inthin pumin ama an lo tuok a, “Thu ṭhaa hung am i nih?” an lo tih a.

en: And he said, Peaceably; I am come to sacrifice unto Jehovah: sanctify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice. And he sanctified Jesse and his sons, and called them to the sacrifice.
hmr: Ama chun, “Thu ṭhaa hung nih e, LALPA kuoma inthâwi dinga hung ka nih; insukthieng unla, inthâwinaah hung ve ro,” a ta. Chun, Jesai le a naupasalhai chu a sukthieng a, inthâwinaa chun a ko ve a.

en: And it came to pass, when they were come, that he looked on Eliab, and said, Surely Jehovah’s anointed is before him.
hmr: Chun, an hung chun, Eliab chu a lo en a, “LALPA hrieknâl chu a hmaa um hi a ni ngei el,” a ta.

en: But Jehovah said unto Samuel, Look not on his countenance, or on the height of his stature; because I have rejected him: for Jehovah seeth not as man seeth; for man looketh on the outward appearance, but Jehovah looketh on the heart.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, LALPA chun Samuel kuoma chun, “A hmêl tieng amanih, ân sang tieng amanih en naw rawh, ama hi chu ka dit naw a nih, LALPA chun mihriem en dân angin a en ve si nawh a, mihriem chun puotienga inlang dân an en hlak a, LALPA ruok chun lungril tieng a en lem hlak a nih,” a ta.

en: Then Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel. And he said, Neither hath Jehovah chosen this.
hmr: Chun, Jesai chun Abinadab a hei ko a, Samuel hmaa chun ân fetir a. Ama chun, “Hi khawm hi LALPA thlang a la ni nawh,” a ta.

en: Then Jesse made Shammah to pass by. And he said, Neither hath Jehovah chosen this.
hmr: Chun, Jesai chun, Samma a vân fetir nâwk a. Ama chun, “Hi khawm hi LALPA thlang a la ni naw ta rawp,” a ta.

en: And Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. And Samuel said unto Jesse, Jehovah hath not chosen these.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jesai chun a nau- pasal pasari hai chu Samuel hmaa chun ân fetir a. Chun, Samuel chun Jesai kuomah, “LALPA chun hieng- hai khawm hi a thlang nawh,” a ta.

en: And Samuel said unto Jesse, Are here all thy children? And he said, There remaineth yet the youngest, and, behold, he is keeping the sheep. And Samuel said unto Jesse, Send and fetch him; for we will not sit down till he come hither.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun Jesai kuomah, “Hitaka hin i nauhai an um kim vawng am?” a ta. Chun, ama chun, “A naupang tak a la um a, ngai ta, berâm a vêng a nih,” a ta. Chun, Samuel chun Jesai kuomah, “Vân kotir raw khai, a hung tlung hmakhat chun ei awt naw ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And he sent, and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, and withal of a beautiful countenance, and goodly to look upon. And Jehovah said, Arise, anoint him; for this is he.
hmr: Chuongchun, a vân kotir a, a hung ṭhuoi a. Ama chu sâr veng vawng, mit meng mawitak, en dâwl- tak el hi a na. Chun, LALPA chun, “Tho la, hriek nâl rawh, hi ngei hi a nih,” a ta.

en: Then Samuel took the horn of oil, and anointed him in the midst of his brethren: and the Spirit of Jehovah came mightily upon David from that day forward. So Samuel rose up, and went to Ramah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samuel chun hriek bâwm ki chu a lâk a, a unauhai lai chun ama chu hriek a nâl a, chun, LALPA thlarau chu nasatakin chu nia inthawk chun David chunga chun a hung tlung tah a. Chuongchun, Samuel chu a tho a, Rama khuoah a fe tah a.

en: Now the Spirit of Jehovah departed from Saul, and an evil spirit from Jehovah troubled him.
hmr: LALPA thlarau chun Saula chu a suoksan a, LALPA tir khawhriin ama chu a sukbuoi a.

en: And Saul’s servants said unto him, Behold now, an evil spirit from God troubleth thee.
hmr: Chun, Saula siehlawhai chun a kuomah, “Ngai ta, Pathien tir khaw- hriin a sukbuoi che a nih.

en: Let our lord now command thy servants, that are before thee, to seek out a man who is a skilful player on the harp: and it shall come to pass, when the evil spirit from God is upon thee, that he shall play with his hand, and thou shalt be well.
hmr: Tûn kan lalpa hin i siehlaw i hmaa umhai hi ṭingṭang kei thiemtak zawng ding thu mi pe raw khai, chuongchun, Pathien tir khawhriin a man pha che khawm, kei a ta, ṭha el hlak i tih,” an ta.

en: And Saul said unto his servants, Provide me now a man that can play well, and bring him to me.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun a siehlawhai kuoma chun, “Kei thiemtak chu mi zawngpêk unla, ka kuomah hung ṭhuoi ro le,” a tih a.

en: Then answered one of the young men, and said, Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Beth-lehemite, that is skilful in playing, and a mighty man of valor, and a man of war, and prudent in speech, and a comely person; and Jehovah is with him.
hmr: Chuongchun, tlangvâl pakhat chun a dawn a, a kuomah, “Ngai ta, Bethlehem mi Jesai naupa pakhat chu ka hmu tah a, ama chu kei thiem- tak, mi huoitak, indo mi, thuhril thiemtak, hmêl ṭhatak a nih; a kuomah LALPA khawm a um a nih,” a ta.

en: Wherefore Saul sent messengers unto Jesse, and said, Send me David thy son, who is with the sheep.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chun Jesai kuoma chun mi a tir a, “I naupa David berâm vênga um chu ka kuomah inhungtir rawh,” a ta.

en: And Jesse took an ass laden with bread, and a bottle of wine, and a kid, and sent them by David his son unto Saul.
hmr: Chun, Jesai chun sabengtung, bei le uoin peng khat phur le, kêlte a lâk a, a naupa David chu Saula pêk dingin ân chawitir a.

en: And David came to Saul, and stood before him: and he loved him greatly; and he became his armorbearer.
hmr: Chun, David chun Saula kuom chu a va tlung a, a hmaa chun a va ngîr a, ama chun a lo ngaina êm êm el a; a râlthuom chawituah a ṭhang tah a.

en: And Saul sent to Jesse, saying, Let David, I pray thee, stand before me; for he hath found favor in my sight.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun Jesai kuom- ah, “David hi ka kuomah um raw se, ka mit a tlung hle el,” tia hril dingin mi a tir a.

en: And it came to pass, when the evil spirit from God was upon Saul, that David took the harp, and played with his hand: so Saul was refreshed, and was well, and the evil spirit departed from him.
hmr: Chun, hieng hi a hung na, Pathien tir khawhriin Saula chu a man po leh, David chun ṭingṭang a lâk a, a kei hlak a; chuongchun, Saula chu a hung har a, a ṭha nâwk hlak a; chun, khawhri chun a suoksan hlak a.

en: Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle; and they were gathered together at Socoh, which belongeth to Judah, and encamped between Socoh and Azekah, in Ephes-dammim.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai chun indo dingin an sipaihai an kei khâwm ṭeu el a. Judai ram sûng Soko khuoah an pungkhâwm a; Ephes- dammim hmunah Soko khuo le Azeka khuo inkâra chun ṭhanghmun an khuor a.

en: And Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together, and encamped in the vale of Elah, and set the battle in array against the Philistines.
hmr: Chun, Saula le Israel mihai chu an pungkhâwm a, Ela ruomah ṭhang- hmun an khuor a, Philistin mihai chu lo dang dingin an inzar dar a.

en: And the Philistines stood on the mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on the mountain on the other side: and there was a valley between them.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai chu tlâng pangah an um a, chun, Israel mihai chu khingtieng tlâng panga chun an um a, an inkâra chun ruom a um a.

en: And there went out a champion out of the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai ṭhang- hmuna inthawk chun an mi hrât, Goliath, Gath khuoa mi, tawng ruk le khâp khata insâng hi a hung suok a.

en: And he had a helmet of brass upon his head, and he was clad with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of brass.
hmr: Dâr lukhum hi a khum a, âwmphaw a hâk a, a âwmphaw rikzie chu dâr shekel sâng nga a nih.

en: And he had greaves of brass upon his legs, and a javelin of brass between his shoulders.
hmr: A ngala chun dâr ngalphaw a bun a, a ruongzânga chun dâr feite a pai a.

en: And the staff of his spear was like a weaver’s beam; and his spear’s head weighed six hundred shekels of iron: and his shield-bearer went before him.
hmr: A fei ngul chu puonkawl ang hi a na, a fei lu chu thîr shekel za ruka rik a nih; chun, a phaw chawitu chu a hmaa chun a feh a.

en: And he stood and cried unto the armies of Israel, and said unto them, Why are ye come out to set your battle in array? am not I a Philistine, and ye servants to Saul? choose you a man for you, and let him come down to me.
hmr: Chun, a ngîr a, Israelhai sipaihai chu a ko a, an kuomah, “Iengdinga indo dinga in hung inzar dar am a na? Kei Philistin mi, nangni Saula siehlawhai in nih a ni naw am a nih? Mi inthlang unla, ka kuomah hung thla raw se.

en: If he be able to fight with me, and kill me, then will we be your servants; but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall ye be our servants, and serve us.
hmr: A mi thaw thei a, a mi sukhlum chun in siehlawah um kan ta, ami- ruokchu, keiin ka ngam a, ka sukhlum chun kan siehlawah um in ta, kan rawngbâwl in tih,” a ta.
