en: And the Philistine said, I defy the armies of Israel this day; give me a man, that we may fight together.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mi chun, “Vawi- sûn hin chu Israelhai sipaihai chu ka cho a nih, mi pakhat hung thaw unla, lo inthâwng kan tih,” a ta.

en: And when Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed, and greatly afraid.
hmr: Chun, Saula le Israelhai po poin chu Philistin mi thuhril an hriet chun an ṭih a, an inlau ta êm êm el a.

en: Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Beth-lehem-judah, whose name was Jesse; and he had eight sons: and the man was an old man in the days of Saul, stricken in years among men.
hmr: Chun, David chu Jesai naupa a na, ama chu Bethlehem-Judaa Ephrath mi kha a na, naupasal pariet a nei a; ama chu Saula inlal lai chun tartak a ni tah a, tarsiea ngai a ni tah.

en: And the three eldest sons of Jesse had gone after Saul to the battle: and the names of his three sons that went to the battle were Eliab the first-born, and next unto him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.
hmr: Chun, Jesai naupasal upahai pathum chun indonaa chun Saula an zui a. A naupasal pathum indonaa fehai hming chu a upa tak Eliab hai, a dawttu Abinadab hai, a pathumna chu Samma hai an nih.

en: And David was the youngest; and the three eldest followed Saul.
hmr: Chun, David chu a naupang tak a na, chun, a upahai pathum chun Saula an zui a.

en: Now David went to and fro from Saul to feed his father’s sheep at Beth-lehem.
hmr: David chu Saula kuoma in- thawkin a pa berâm enkawl dingin Bethlehema chun a va fe a va fe hlak a.

en: And the Philistine drew near morning and evening, and presented himself forty days.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mi chun zîngkâr le zântieng po hin a va hnai hlak a, ni sâwmli sûng zet chu a vân târlang hlak a.

en: And Jesse said unto David his son, Take now for thy brethren an ephah of this parched grain, and these ten loaves, and carry them quickly to the camp to thy brethren;
hmr: Chun, Jesai chun a naupa David kuoma chun, “Bu zeu epha khat le hi bei tlang sâwm hi chawi la, i unauhai kuomah riekhmunah va fepui vak raw khai;

en: and bring these ten cheeses unto the captain of their thousand, and look how thy brethren fare, and take their pledge.
hmr: chun, nêne tui kîng tlang sâwm hi an pâwla sâng hotu chawipêk la, chun, i unauhai iengtin am an um hung indawn la, an chanchin hrietna hung phur rawh.

en: Now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel, were in the vale of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.
hmr: Saula le anni le Israel mi po po chu Philistin mihai doin Ela ruoma chun tûn an um a nih,” a ta.

en: And David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the place of the wagons, as the host which was going forth to the fight shouted for the battle.
hmr: Chun, David chu zîngkâr a tho a, berâmhai chu vêngtu pakhat ân kawltir a, Jesaiin thu a pêk ang chun a chawi a, a fe tah a; chun, indona hmuna suok mêk sipaihai chu inthaw dinga an lo khêk dur dur lai takin ama chu tawlailîr umna hmun chu a va tlung a.

en: And Israel and the Philistines put the battle in array, army against army.
hmr: Chun, Israel mihai le Philistin mihai chu indo ding chun an lo inzar a, sipai le sipai chu an lo inep a.

en: And David left his baggage in the hand of the keeper of the baggage, and ran to the army, and came and saluted his brethren.
hmr: Chun, David chun a thuom- hnaw chu thuomhnaw enkawltu kuoma chun a sieh a, indona hmun tieng chun a va tlân a; a uhai chu chibai a va bûk a.

en: And as he talked with them, behold, there came up the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, out of the ranks of the Philistines, and spake according to the same words: and David heard them.
hmr: Chun, anni a biek lai chun, ngai ta, an mi hrât Gath khuoa Philistin mi a hming Goliath chu Philistin mihai sipai pâwl laia chu a hung suok a, a thuhril ngai bawk kha a hung hril a, chu chu David chun a lo hriet zing a.

en: And all the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him, and were sore afraid.
hmr: Israel mihai po po chun ama chu an hei hmu chun an tlânseh a, an ṭi êm êm el a.

en: And the men of Israel said, Have ye seen this man that is come up? surely to defy Israel is he come up: and it shall be, that the man who killeth him, the king will enrich him with great riches, and will give him his daughter, and make his father’s house free in Israel.
hmr: Chun, Israel mihai chun, “Kha mihriem a hung suokpa kha in hmu am? Israel mihai cho dinga hung suok a ni ngei el; tukhawm ama sukhlum taphawt chu lalin ama chu sum tiengin sukhausâng a ta; chun, a nau- nu pêng a ta, chun, a pa sûngkuohai chu Israelhai lai hin zalênin inumtir a tih,” an ta.

en: And David spake to the men that stood by him, saying, What shall be done to the man that killeth this Philistine, and taketh away the reproach from Israel? for who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?
hmr: Chun, David chun a kâwla ngîrhai kuoma chun, “Hi Philistin mi hi sukhlum a, Israelhai hmingsietna sukbotu chu iengti anga thaw ding am nîng a ta? Hi sertan lo Philistin mi hi tu am a na Pathien hring sipaihai a hei cho vei chu?” a ta.

en: And the people answered him after this manner, saying, So shall it be done to the man that killeth him.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chun hieng ang hin an dawn a, “A sukhlumtu ta- phawt chu kan hril anga kha thaw ding a nih,” an ta.

en: And Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spake unto the men; and Eliab’s anger was kindled against David, and he said, Why art thou come down? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know thy pride, and the naughtiness of thy heart; for thou art come down that thou mightest see the battle.
hmr: Chun, a u, a upa tak Eliab chun mihai kuoma a thu hril lai chu a lo hriet a: chuongchun, Eliab chu David chunga chun a lunginsen ta thut a, “Iengdinga i hung thla ve am a na? Thlalêra berâm tlâwmte um kha tu am în vêngtir leh? I chapozie le i lungril ṭhat nawzie ka hriet a nih: indo dâm en dingin i hung vei rawk a,” a ta.

en: And David said, What have I now done? Is there not a cause?
hmr: Chun, David chun, “Ieng am ka thaw ta leh? A san a um a ni naw am a nih?” a ta.

en: And he turned away from him toward another, and spake after the same manner: and the people answered him again after the former manner.
hmr: Chun, ama chun mi dang kuom tieng a nghatsan a, a hril ngai bawk a hril a; chun, mipuihai chun a hmaa an dawn ang bawk khan an dawn a.

en: And when the words were heard which David spake, they rehearsed them before Saul; and he sent for him.
hmr: Chun, David thuhril chu an hrietin Saula kuomah an hrilsâwng a; chun, ama chun a ko a.

en: And David said to Saul, Let no man’s heart fail because of him; thy servant will go and fight with this Philistine.
hmr: Chun, David chun Saula kuom- ah, “Ama lei chun tu lungril khawm ṭi naw raw se; i siehlaw hin chu Philistin mi chu va thâwng ka tih,” a ta.

en: And Saul said to David, Thou art not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him; for thou art but a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.
hmr: Chun, Saulân David kuomah, “Nang chu, hi Philistin mi hi thaw dingin fe thei êm naw ti nih ie, tleirâwl el i la ni sih a, ama chu a tleirâwl tîra inthawka indo mi a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: And David said unto Saul, Thy servant was keeping his father’s sheep; and when there came a lion, or a bear, and took a lamb out of the flock,
hmr: Chun, David chun Saula kuom- ah, “I siehlaw hin ka pa berâm ka vêng hlak a, sakeibaknei amanih, savawm amanih a hunga berâm ruol laia berâmte dâm a lâk hin,

en: I went out after him, and smote him, and delivered it out of his mouth; and when he arose against me, I caught him by his beard, and smote him, and slew him.
hmr: ka hnawt a, ka thawh a, a baua inthawk chu ka sansuok hlak a nih; chun, mi thaw dinga a hung inthawk dâm hin a bakhmulah ka man a, ka thawh a, ka sukhlum hlak a nih.

en: Thy servant smote both the lion and the bear: and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing he hath defied the armies of the living God.
hmr: I siehlaw hin sakeibaknei le savawm khawm ka sukhlum ve ve ta hlak a; chu sertan lo Philistin mi chu anni ang bawk chun um ve el a ti maw le, Pathien hring sipaihai a cho vei a,” a ta.

en: And David said, Jehovah that delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, he will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine. And Saul said unto David, Go, and Jehovah shall be with thee.
hmr: Chun, David chun, “Sakeibak- nei kutbâwra inthawk le, savawm kutbâwra inthawka mi sansuoktu LALPA chun chu Philistin mi kuta inthawk chun mi sansuok a tih,” a ta. Chun, Saula chun David kuoma chun, “Fe raw le, i kuomah LALPA um a tih” a ta.

en: And Saul clad David with his apparel, and he put a helmet of brass upon his head, and he clad him with a coat of mail.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun David chu ama thuomin a thuom a, dâr lukhum ân khumtir a, âwmphaw ân hâktir a,

en: And David girded his sword upon his apparel, and he assayed to go; for he had not proved it. And David said unto Saul, I cannot go with these; for I have not proved them. And David put them off him.
hmr: Chun, David chun thuom chunga chun a kâwlhnâm a pai a, fe a hang tum a, chuong ang chun a la thaw sin ngai si nawh a. Chun, David chun Saula kuomah, “Ka fepui thei dêr âwm nawh a, hieng ang hin ka la thaw sin ngai nawha a nih,” a ta. Chuongchun, David chu ân hlîp tah a.

en: And he took his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in the shepherd’s bag which he had, even in his wallet; and his sling was in his hand: and he drew near to the Philistine.
hmr: Chun, a hmawl chu a chawi a, vadungtêa lung inmûm ṭhelṭhawl panga a thlang a, a berâm vêngna mansaa chun a pai a; chun, a vailungdêng chu a chawi a, Philistin mi chu a va hnai tah a.

en: And the Philistine came on and drew near unto David; and the man that bare the shield went before him.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mi chu a hung a, David chu a hung pan hnai a; chun, phaw chawitu chu a hmaa chun a feh a.

en: And when the Philistine looked about, and saw David, he disdained him; for he was but a youth, and ruddy, and withal of a fair countenance.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mi chu a hang ngha vêl a, David chu a hmu chun a hmusit hle el a; sâr hlerhlawr, mit meng mawitak, tleirâwl el a ni sih a.

en: And the Philistine said unto David, Am I a dog, that thou comest to me with staves? And the Philistine cursed David by his gods.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mi chun David kuoma chun, “Ui am ka nia hmawl le dâm i mi hung pan chu le?” a ta. Chuongchun, Philistin mi chun a pathienhai sâlin David chu ṭawngsie ân phur tah a.

en: And the Philistine said to David, Come to me, and I will give thy flesh unto the birds of the heavens, and to the beasts of the field.
hmr: Philistin mi chun David kuom- ah, “Hung ta, i sahai kha ramsahai le chunglêng vatehai lo infâktir ka tih,” a ta.

en: Then said David to the Philistine, Thou comest to me with a sword, and with a spear, and with a javelin: but I come to thee in the name of Jehovah of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom thou hast defied.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Philistin mi kuoma chun, “Nang chu kawlhnâm dâm, fei dâm, phaw dâm chawiin i hung inthawk a, kei chu sipaihai LALPA Israel sipaihai LAL- PA i cho hmingin ka hung inthawk lem a nih.

en: This day will Jehovah deliver thee into my hand; and I will smite thee, and take thy head from off thee; and I will give the dead bodies of the host of the Philistines this day unto the birds of the heavens, and to the wild beasts of the earth; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel,
hmr: Vawisûn hin LALPAIN nang hi ka kutah a mi pêk ding a nih, chun, that ka ti cheh a, i lu ka tanpêk ding che a nih; chun, Philistin sipaihai ruong chu vawisûn hin ramsahai le chunglêng vatehai kân fâktir ding a nih; chuongchun, hnuoi chunga mi po po hin Israelhai lai hin Pathien a um ti hre thei an tih;

en: and that all this assembly may know that Jehovah saveth not with sword and spear: for the battle is Jehovah’s, and he will give you into our hand.
hmr: chun, hitaka pungkhâwmhai po po hin LALPA chun kâwlhnâm le feiin a sandam nawh ti hre thei an tih; indona chu LALPA indona a ni sih a, ama chun kan kuta hin nangni hi a mi pêk ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, when the Philistine arose, and came and drew nigh to meet David, that David hastened, and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mi chu a hung inthawka David chu thaw dinga a hung hnai chun David chu sipaihai tieng chun Philistin mi chu thaw dingin a tlân ta vat a.

en: And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and slang it, and smote the Philistine in his forehead; and the stone sank into his forehead, and he fell upon his face to the earth.
hmr: Chun, David chun a mansa chu a hang pur a, lung a keidawk a, a vailungdêng chun a hei dêng a, Philistin mi chu a bâwk taka chun a hei dêng a, a bâwka chun lung chu a lût a, a tlu bawkkhup ta dêr el a.

en: So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and smote the Philistine, and slew him; but there was no sword in the hand of David.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Philistin mi chu vailungdêng le lungin a ngam a, Philistin mi chu a dêng a, a that tah a; David chun kâwlhnâm a chawi dêr nawh a.

en: Then David ran, and stood over the Philistine, and took his sword, and drew it out of the sheath thereof, and slew him, and cut off his head therewith. And when the Philistines saw that their champion was dead, they fled.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu a tlân a, Philistin mi kâwla chun a va ngîr a, a kâwlhnâm chu a lâk a, a bâwma inthawk chu a phawi a, chu chun a that a, a lu a tan tah a. Chun, Philistin mihai chun an mi hrât chu a thi ti an hriet chun an tlânse tah a.

en: And the men of Israel and of Judah arose, and shouted, and pursued the Philistines, until thou comest to Gai, and to the gates of Ekron. And the wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even unto Gath, and unto Ekron.
hmr: Chun, Israel mihai le Juda mi- hai chu an tho a, an khêk a, Philistin mihai chu Gath chen le Ekron kul kawtkhâr chen rakin an hnawt tah a. Chun, Philistin mihai laia hliemhai chu Saaraim lampui intluonin Gath le Ekron chen chun an tlu phung el a nih.

en: And the children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines, and they plundered their camp.
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai chun Phi- listin mihai an hnawt chu an kîrsan a, an riekhmun chu an suom tah a.

en: And David took the head of the Philistine, and brought it to Jerusalem; but he put his armor in his tent.
hmr: Chun, David chun Philistin mi lu chu a lâk a, Jerusalemah a fepui a, a râlthuom ruok chu a puon inah a sieh a.

en: And when Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine, he said unto Abner, the captain of the host, Abner, whose son is this youth? And Abner said, As thy soul liveth, O king, I cannot tell.
hmr: Chun, Saulan Philistin mihai thaw dinga David a fe lai a hmu khan sipai hotu Abner kuoma chun, “Abner, hi tleirâwl hi tu nau am a na?” a ta. Chun, Abner chun, “I hring- na sâlin ka hril a nih, aw lalpa, ka hriet dêr nawh a,” a ta.

en: And the king said, Inquire thou whose son the stripling is.
hmr: Chun, lal chun, “Hi naupang hi tu nau am a na, indawn suok raw khai,” a ta.

en: And as David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, Abner took him, and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.
hmr: Chun, David chu Philistin mi a that a hung chu Abner chun a ṭhuoi a, Philistin mi lu chu chawi pumin Saula kuomah a fepui a.

en: And Saul said to him, Whose son art thou, thou young man? And David answered, I am the son of thy servant Jesse the Beth-lehemite.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “Tu naupa am i nih a, tlangvâl?” a ta. David chun a dawn a, “Bethlehem mi i siehlaw Jesai naupa ka nih,” tiin, a dawn a.

en: And it came to pass, when he had made an end of speaking unto Saul, that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul.
hmr: Chun, Saula kuoma thu a hril zo chun Jonathan hringna le David hringna chu a lo inzawm ta chie el a, chuongchun, Jonathan chun ama hringna a hmangai ang chiein a hmangai tah a.

en: And Saul took him that day, and would let him go no more home to his father’s house.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun chu ni chun ân umtir ta nghâl a, a pa ina chun ân fetir phal ta nawh a.

en: Then Jonathan and David made a covenant, because he loved him as his own soul.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jonathan le David chun thu an thlung a, ama hringna ang chiea a hmangai leiin.

en: And Jonathan stripped himself of the robe that was upon him, and gave it to David, and his apparel, even to his sword, and to his bow, and to his girdle.
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun a puon sil lai a hlîp a, David chu a pêk a, a thuom le a kâwlhnâm le a thalngul le a kâwng khitna chenin a pêk a.

en: And David went out whithersoever Saul sent him, and behaved himself wisely: and Saul set him over the men of war, and it was good in the sight of all the people, and also in the sight of Saul’s servants.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun a tirna ta- phawta chun David chu a fe hlak a, feltakin a châng pei a; chun, Saula chun râl kâp mihai hotu dingin a siem a, chu chu mi po po ngaia le Saula siehlawhai ngaia khawm a ṭha êm êm a.

en: And it came to pass as they came, when David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, that the women came out of all the cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet king Saul, with timbrels, with joy, and with instruments of music.
hmr: Chun, an hung inlawi a, Philistin mi thata David a hung kîr chun Israel khaw tinah, nuhmeihai hla sak le lâm pumin khuongtê le thil inri theihai leh, hlimtakin lal Saula tuok dingin an hung suok a.

en: And the women sang one to another as they played, and said, Saul hath slain his thousands, And David his ten thousands.
hmr: Chun, nuhmeihai chun lâm pum- in hlain an indawn tuoh a. “Saulain a sânga sâng a that a, Davidin a sînga sîng a that a,” an tih a.

en: And Saul was very wroth, and this saying displeased him; and he said, They have ascribed unto David ten thousands, and to me they have ascribed but thousands: and what can he have more but the kingdom?
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chu a lung- insen ta vieu el a, chuong thu chun ama a suklâwm naw hle el a, “David chu a sînga sîng thatah an ngai a, kei ruok chu a sânga sâng chau thatah an mi ngai a: ram ti chau lo chu ieng am a nei ding dang a um ta leh?” a ta.

en: And Saul eyed David from that day and forward.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu nia inthawk chun Saula chun David chu a hmusiet tah a.

en: And it came to pass on the morrow, that an evil spirit from God came mightily upon Saul, and he prophesied in the midst of the house: and David played with his hand, as he did day by day. And Saul had his spear in his hand;
hmr: Chun, a zînga chun Pathien tir khawhri Saula chunga chun a hung tlung ta rak el a, in sûnga chun thu chu a hril ta nuk nuk el a, chun, David chun ni danga a thaw dân ang bawkin ṭingṭang a kei a: Saula chun a fei chu a chawi zing a.

en: and Saul cast the spear; for he said, I will smite David even to the wall. And David avoided out of his presence twice.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun fei chu a hang inlet a, “Banga sawn David khâw de tlat ka tih,” a ta. David chun vawi hni ân kiensan a.

en: And Saul was afraid of David, because Jehovah was with him, and was departed from Saul.
hmr: Chun, a kuoma LALPA a um lei le, Saula chu a fesan leiin Saula chun David chu a ṭih a.

en: Therefore Saul removed him from him, and made him his captain over a thousand; and he went out and came in before the people.
hmr: Chuleiin, Saula chun a kuoma inthawkin ân sawntir a, sâng chunga sipai hotuah a siem a, chun, mipuihai lai chun a lûtin a suok hlak.

en: And David behaved himself wisely in all his ways; and Jehovah was with him.
hmr: Chun, David chu a thilthaw taphawtah feltakin a châng hlak a, LALPA chu a kuomah a um a.

en: And when Saul saw that he behaved himself very wisely, he stood in awe of him.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun feltakin a châng hlak ti a hmuin a ṭi hle el a.

en: But all Israel and Judah loved David; for he went out and came in before them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Israelhai le Judahai po po chun David chu an ngaina êm êm a, anni laia lûta suok hlak a ni sih a.

en: And Saul said to David, Behold, my elder daughter Merab, her will I give thee to wife: only be thou valiant for me, and fight Jehovah’s battles. For Saul said, Let not my hand be upon him, but let the hand of the Philistines be upon him.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun David kuom- ah, “Ngai ta, ka naunuhmei upa lem Merab hi nuhmeiah inneitir ka ti che, huoitakin mi ṭan phawt el la. LALPA indonahai chu do rawh,” a ta. Saula chun, “Kei chun chu a chunga hin kutthlâk loin, Philistin mihaiin thlâk lem raw se,” a ti a nih.

en: And David said unto Saul, Who am I, and what is my life, or my father’s family in Israel, that I should be son-in-law to the king?
hmr: Chun, David chun Saula kuom- ah, “Tu am ka na, ka hringna le Israelhai lai ka pa sûnghai chu ieng am an na, lal mâkpa ka hang nina san ding chu?” a ta.

en: But it came to pass at the time when Merab, Saul’s daughter, should have been given to David, that she was given unto Adriel the Meholathite to wife.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Saula naunu Merab chu David inneitir a hung hun chun Meholath mi Adriel nuhmei dingin a pêk ta el a.

en: And Michal, Saul’s daughter, loved David: and they told Saul, and the thing pleased him.
hmr: Chun, Saula naunu Mikal chun David chu a hmangai a, Saula chu an hril a, chu chun a suklâwm a.

en: And Saul said, I will give him her, that she may be a snare to him, and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him. Wherefore Saul said to David, Thou shalt this day be my son-in-law a second time.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “A âwkna châng a hung ni theina dingin le Philistin mihaiin a chunga kut an thlâk theina dingin ama hi pêng ka tih,” a ta. Chuleiin, Saula chun David kuoma a vawi hninaah chun, “Vawisûn hin ka mâkpa ning i tih,” a ta.

en: And Saul commanded his servants, saying, Commune with David secretly, and say, Behold, the king hath delight in thee, and all his servants love thee: now therefore be the king’s son-in-law.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chun a siehlawhai chu thu a pêk a, “Inrûk takin David be unla, ‘Ngai ta, lal chu i chungah a lâwm hle el a, a siehlawhai po po khawma an hmangai che a nih; chuongchun, lal mâkpaa hin um el rawh,’ ti ro,” a ta.

en: And Saul’s servants spake those words in the ears of David. And David said, Seemeth it to you a light thing to be the king’s son-in-law, seeing that I am a poor man, and lightly esteemed?
hmr: Chun, Saula siehlawhai chun chuong thuhai chu David na hrieta chun an hril a. David chun, “Mi pasie le tukhawm ingaisâng naw keia ta ding hin lal mâkpa hang ni chu thil namênah in ngai am a nih?” a ta.

en: And the servants of Saul told him, saying, On this manner spake David.
hmr: Chun, Saula siehlawhai chun, “David chun chuong ang chun a ti a nih,” tiin an hril a.

en: And Saul said, Thus shall ye say to David, The king desireth not any dowry, but a hundred foreskins of the Philistines, to be avenged of the king’s enemies. Now Saul thought to make David fall by the hand of the Philistines.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “David kuoma chun hieng ang hin ti ro khai, ‘Lal chun lal hmêlma phubalâkna dingin Philistin mihai servun za ti naw chu man ieng dang khawm a dit nawh,’ tiin,” a ta. Saula chun David chu Philistin mihai kuta inthitir a lungril tlat a.

en: And when his servants told David these words, it pleased David well to be the king’s son-in-law. And the days were not expired;
hmr: Chun, a siehlawhaiin chuong thu chu David an hang hril chun, lal mâkpa a hang ni ding chu David chu a lâwm hle el a. Chun, ni tiemhai chu a la tling nawh a.

en: and David arose and went, he and his men, and slew of the Philistines two hundred men; and David brought their foreskins, and they gave them in full number to the king, that he might be the king’s son-in-law. And Saul gave him Michal his daughter to wife.
hmr: David le a mihai chu an tho a, Philistin mi za hni an va that a: David chun an ser vun chu a hung phur a, chuongchun, lal mâkpa a ni theina dingin lal chu kimtakin an pêk a. Chuongchun, Saula chun a naunu Mikal chu nuhmeiah ân neitir tah a.

en: And Saul saw and knew that Jehovah was with David; and Michal, Saul’s daughter, loved him.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun David kuoma chun Pathien a um a nih ti a hriet chieng tah a: chun, Saula naunu Mikal chun ama chu a hmangai a.

en: And Saul was yet the more afraid of David; and Saul was David’s enemy continually.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chun David chu a ṭi zuol ta sau a, Saula chu David hmêlma a ni kumkhuo el tah a.

en: Then the princes of the Philistines went forth: and it came to pass, as often as they went forth, that David behaved himself more wisely than all the servants of Saul; so that his name was much set by.
hmr: Chuongchun, Philistin mi lien- hai chu an vân thawk hlak a; chun, an hung inthawk dawk po leh David chu Saula siehlawhai po po nêka fel lemin a châng hlak a, chuongchun, a hming chu an chawisâng hle el tah a.

en: And Saul spake to Jonathan his son, and to all his servants, that they should slay David. But Jonathan, Saul’s son, delighted much in David.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chun a naupa Jonathan le a siehlaw- hai po po chu David chu that dingin a hril a.

en: And Jonathan told David, saying, Saul my father seeketh to slay thee: now therefore, I pray thee, take heed to thyself in the morning, and abide in a secret place, and hide thyself:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Saula naupa Jonathan chun David chu a ngaina hle el a. Chuongchun, Jonathan chun David chu, “Ka pa Saula chun that a tum cheh a, chuleiin, zîngah zîngkâr chun fîmkhur la, hmun inthupah inbi zing raw khai;

en: and I will go out and stand beside my father in the field where thou art, and I will commune with my father of thee; and if I see aught, I will tell thee.
hmr: chun, fe suok ka ta, i umna phûlah ka pa kâwlah va ngîr ka ta, i chungchâng thuah ka pa bieng ka ta, ieng amanih ka hriet chun hril ka ti che,” a ta.

en: And Jonathan spake good of David unto Saul his father, and said unto him, Let not the king sin against his servant, against David; because he hath not sinned against thee, and because his works have been to thee-ward very good:
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun a pa Saula hmaa chun David chu ân pâk a, a kuomah, “Lal chun a siehlaw chung- ah, David chunga hin thil suol thaw lul naw raw se, i chungah iengkhawm a suksuol si nawh a, a thilthawhai chu i ta dinga ṭhatak a ni sih a;

en: for he put his life in his hand, and smote the Philistine, and Jehovah wrought a great victory for all Israel: thou sawest it, and didst rejoice; wherefore then wilt thou sin against innocent blood, to slay David without a cause?
hmr: thi dâwn loin Philistin mi kha a thawh a, chun LALPAIN Israel mihai po po sandamna ropuitak a thaw- suokpêk a, chu chu nang khawma i hmuh a, lâwm khawm i lâwm hle kha; chuleiin, a san iengkhawm um loa David chu thatin, ieng dingin am thisen pawi tâwklo chunga chun thil suksuol el i ta?” a ta.

en: And Saul hearkened unto the voice of Jonathan: and Saul sware, As Jehovah liveth, he shall not be put to death.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chun Jona- than rawl chu a ngai a, Saula chun, “Ṭawng inkhâmin, LALPA hringna sâlin ka hril a nih, ama chu sukhlum ni naw tawp a tih,” a ta.

en: And Jonathan called David, and Jonathan showed him all those things. And Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he was in his presence, as beforetime.
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun David chu a ko a, Jonathan chun chuong thil po po chu a hril a. Chun, Jonathan chun David chu Saula kuoma chun a ṭhuoi a, inhma ang bawk khan a kuoma chun a um nâwk tah a.

en: And there was war again: and David went out, and fought with the Philistines, and slew them with a great slaughter; and they fled before him.
hmr: Chun, indona a hung um nâwk a, chuongchun, David chu ân thawk suok a, Philistin mihai chu a va thawh a, a va that ṭeu a, a hmaa chun an tlânseh a.

en: And an evil spirit from Jehovah was upon Saul, as he sat in his house with his spear in his hand; and David was playing with his hand.
hmr: Chun, Saula chu a ina fei chawia a ṭhung laiin LALPA tir khawhri a chungah a hung tlung a; chun, David chun ṭingṭang a kei a.

en: And Saul sought to smite David even to the wall with the spear; but he slipped away out of Saul’s presence, and he smote the spear into the wall: and David fled, and escaped that night.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun a fei chun David chu banga khâwde tlat a tum a; nisienlakhawm, Saula kuoma in- thawk chun a fe hmang vat a, fei chu banga chun a khâw bûr ta chut el a; chun, David chu a tlân suok a, chu zân chun a him tah a.

en: And Saul sent messengers unto David’s house, to watch him, and to slay him in the morning: and Michal, David’s wife, told him, saying, If thou save not thy life to-night, to-morrow thou wilt be slain.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun David chu in tienga zîngkâra lo inchâna that dingin mi a tir a; chun, David nuhmei Mikal chun, “Vawizân hin i hringna i humhim naw chun, zînga hin an that ding che a nih,” tiin a hril a.

en: So Michal let David down through the window: and he went, and fled, and escaped.
hmr: Chuongchun, Mikal chun David chu tukverah a thlâk thla a, chuongchun, a tlân hmang a, a him tah a.

en: And Michal took the teraphim, and laid it in the bed, and put a pillow of goats’ hair at the head thereof, and covered it with the clothes.
hmr: Chun, Mikal chun milim chu a lâk a, khuma chun ân zâltir a; chun, a lu tieng chun kêl hmul lukham a sieh a, puonin ân khum a.

en: And when Saul sent messengers to take David, she said, He is sick.
hmr: Chun, David ṭhuoi dinga Saulan mi a hung tir chu, “A dam nawh,” a lo ta.

en: And Saul sent the messengers to see David, saying, Bring him up to me in the bed, that I may slay him.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun David va en dingin mi a tir a, “A khum pumin hung zâwn suok unla, lo that el ka tih,” a ta.

en: And when the messengers came in, behold, the teraphim was in the bed, with the pillow of goats’ hair at the head thereof.
hmr: Chun, a mi tirhai chu an va lût chun, ngai ta, khuma chun milim chu a lu tienga kêl hmul lukham khamin a lo um a.

en: And Saul said unto Michal, Why hast thou deceived me thus, and let mine enemy go, so that he is escaped? And Michal answered Saul, He said unto me, Let me go; why should I kill thee?
hmr: Saula chun Mikal kuoma chun, “Ieng dinga hienga i mi hlêm a, a himna dinga ka hmêlma chu în suoktir am a na?” a ta.

en: Now David fled, and escaped, and came to Samuel to Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him. And he and Samuel went and dwelt in Naioth.
hmr: Tûn David chu a tlân hmang a, a him tah a, Rama khuoa Samuel kuomah a va tlung a, a chunga Saula thilthawhai po po chu a hril a. Chun, ama le Samuel chu an feh a, Naiothah an um a.

en: And it was told Saul, saying, Behold, David is at Naioth in Ramah.
hmr: Chun, Saula chu, “Ngai ta, David chu Rama khuoa Naiothah a um” ti an hril a.

en: And Saul sent messengers to take David: and when they saw the company of the prophets prophesying, and Samuel standing as head over them, the Spirit of God came upon the messengers of Saul, and they also prophesied.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu va ṭhuoi dingin Saula chun mitirhai a tir a, chun, zâwlnei ruolin thu an hril duol duol lai le Samuel an chunga hotua um an va hmu chun, Saula mitirhai chunga chun Pathien thlarau a hung tlung a, anni khawm chun thu an hril ve ta duol duol a.

en: And when it was told Saul, he sent other messengers, and they also prophesied. And Saul sent messengers again the third time, and they also prophesied.
hmr: Chu chu Saula an hang hril chun, mi dang a tir nâwk a, anni khawm chun thu an va hril ve ta duol duol el a.

en: Then went he also to Ramah, and came to the great well that is in Secu: and he asked and said, Where are Samuel and David? And one said, Behold, they are at Naioth in Ramah.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama khawm chu Rama khuoa chun a fe ve tah a; chun, Seku hmuna tuisunsuo lientak hmun chu a va tlung a, “Samuel le David hi khâwlai am an um a?” tiin ân dawn a. Chun, tuin amani hin, “Ngai ta, Rama khuoa Naiothah an um,” a ta.

en: And he went thither to Naioth in Ramah: and the Spirit of God came upon him also, and he went on, and prophesied, until he came to Naioth in Ramah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Rama khuoa Naiotha chun a feh a, chun, Pathien thlarau chu a chunga chun a hung tlung ve tah a, a fe pei a, Rama khuoa Naioth a tlung hmakhat chun thu a hril malam pei a.

en: And he also stripped off his clothes, and he also prophesied before Samuel, and lay down naked all that day and all that night. Wherefore they say, Is Saul also among the prophets?
hmr: Chun, ama khawmin a silfênhai a hlîp veh a, Samuel hmaa chun thu a hril ve ta nuk nuk a, chu ni zânkhuo le sûnnithlâk chun ruokin a zâl a. Chuleiin, “Saula khawm chu zâwl- neihai lai a ṭhang ve el am a ni tah?” ti hi an chîng sawng tah a.

en: And Hannah prayed, and said: My heart exulteth in Jehovah; My horn is exalted in Jehovah; My mouth is enlarged over mine enemies; Because I rejoice in thy salvation.
hmr: Hanna chu a ṭawngṭai a, “LALPA chungah ka lungril a lâwm êm êm a; Ka ki chu LALPAA chawimawiin a um a; Ka hmêlmahai chungah ka bau suklienin a um a, I sandamnaa chun ka lâwm êm êm leiin.

en: There is none holy as Jehovah; For there is none besides thee, Neither is there any rock like our God.
hmr: LALPA anga inthieng hi an um nawh; Nangma ang hrim an um si nawh; Ei Pathien ang lungpui hrim a um bawk nawh;

en: Talk no more so exceeding proudly; Let not arrogancy come out of your mouth; For Jehovah is a God of knowledge, And by him actions are weighed.
hmr: Chuong ang taka chapo chun thu hril ta naw unla, In baua inthawkin ṭawng chapo hrim hrim suok naw raw se; LALPA chu varna Pathien a ni sih a, Ama chun thilthawhai chu a bûk fie hlak.

en: The bows of the mighty men are broken; And they that stumbled are girded with strength.
hmr: Mi hrât thalngulhai a sukthliek a, A kathai kâwng chu hrâtnaa khitin a um a,

en: They that were full have hired out themselves for bread; And they that were hungry have ceased to hunger: Yea, the barren hath borne seven; And she that hath many children languisheth.
hmr: Khawp hlakhai chu fâk ding zawngin an inhlawfa tah a, Phîngṭâm hlakhai chu an phîng a ṭâm ta nawh a; Anih, ching chun pasari a nei tah a, Nau tamtak neinu chu a châu tah,

en: Jehovah killeth, and maketh alive: He bringeth down to Sheol, and bringeth up.
hmr: LALPA chun a sukhlum hlak a, a sukhring bawk hlak, Thlânah ân fe thlâktir hlak a, a ṭhuoi suok bawk hlak.

en: Jehovah maketh poor, and maketh rich: He bringeth low, he also lifteth up.
hmr: LALPA chun a sukpase hlak a, a sukhausa bawk hlak, A suktlâwm hlak a, a chawisâng bawk hlak.

en: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, He lifteth up the needy from the dunghill, To make them sit with princes, And inherit the throne of glory: For the pillars of the earth are Jehovah’s, And he hath set the world upon them.
hmr: Pilvuta inthawkin pasie chu a keitho hlak a, Pasie chu êkdûra inthawkin a chawikâng hlak, Mi lienhai kuomah ân umtir theina ding le, Ropuina lalṭhungpha an chang theina dingin, Leihnuoi innghatsan chu LALPA ta a nih; Khawvêl chu a chungah ân nghat ta sih a.

en: He will keep the feet of his holy ones; But the wicked shall be put to silence in darkness; For by strength shall no man prevail.
hmr: A mi inthieng ke chu vêng a ta, Mi suolhai ruok chu inthim hnuoiah sukdei ṭhapin um an tih; Hrâtna chun tukhawma an ngam âwm si nawh a.

en: They that strive with Jehovah shall be broken to pieces; Against them will he thunder in heaven: Jehovah will judge the ends of the earth; And he will give strength unto his king, And exalt the horn of his anointed.
hmr: LALPA insuolpuihai chu kawinawiin um an ta, Vâna inthawka vâninrûmin do a ta; LALPA chun kâwlkawdawng chenin rorêl a tih; A lal chu hrâtna pêng a ta, A hrieknâl ki chu chawimawi a tih,” a ta.

en: And Elkanah went to Ramah to his house. And the child did minister unto Jehovah before Eli the priest.
hmr: Chuongchun, Elkana chu Rama khuoa a ina chun a fe nâwk tah a. Chun, naupang chun thiempu Eli hmaa chun LALPA rawng chu a bâwl tah a.

en: Now the sons of Eli were base men; they knew not Jehovah.
hmr: Eli naupasalhai chu Belial nauhai an na, LALPA chu an hriet nawh a.

en: And the custom of the priests with the people was, that, when any man offered sacrifice, the priest’s servant came, while the flesh was boiling, with a flesh-hook of three teeth in his hand;
hmr: Chun, mipuihai laia thiempu- hai thaw dân chu, miin inthâwina an hung inhlân hin, sa suong laitak hin thiempu siehlaw hi sa thurna thîrkut zum thum nei mi chawiin a hung hlak a;

en: and he struck it into the pan, or kettle, or caldron, or pot; all that the flesh-hook brought up the priest took therewith. So they did in Shiloh unto all the Israelites that came thither.
hmr: chun, bêl bau lien amanih, bêl dâwt nei amanih, bêl khaina nei amanih, bêl amani sûng chu a zuk sun a; chun, chu sa thurna inzumin a hung thur suok po po chu thiempu chun a lâk hlak a nih. Chuong ang chun Israel mihai chutaka hung po pohai chu Silo khuoa chun an lo thawpêk hlak a.

en: Yea, before they burnt the fat, the priest’s servant came, and said to the man that sacrificed, Give flesh to roast for the priest; for he will not have boiled flesh of thee, but raw.
hmr: Anih, a thâu chu an raw hma chun thiempu siehlaw chu a hung a, ân thâwitu kuoma chun, “Thiempu ta dinga emhmin ding sa mi pe rawh, i sa suong chu a du nawh a, a sel a dit a nih,” a ti hlak a.

en: And if the man said unto him, They will surely burn the fat first, and then take as much as thy soul desireth; then he would say, Nay, but thou shalt give it me now: and if not, I will take it by force.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “A thâu chu raw phawt el sienla; chun, chu zova chun i hringnain a dit zât zât i lâk ding annâwm,” a lo ti chun, “Ni lo, i mi pêk naw chun la lui hrim hrim ka tih,” a ti hlak a.

en: And the sin of the young men was very great before Jehovah; for the men despised the offering of Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, tlangvâlhai suol- na chu LALPA mithmuah a lo nasa ta êm êm el a, mihai chun LALPA kuoma inthâwina inhlânhai chu an ngainêp pha ta sih a.

en: But Samuel ministered before Jehovah, being a child, girded with a linen ephod.
hmr: Samuel chu naupang ni sien khawm, puon zai inhmi zakawsîng hâkin LALPA hmaah rawng a bâwl a.

en: Moreover his mother made him a little robe, and brought it to him from year to year, when she came up with her husband to offer the yearly sacrifice.
hmr: Chu naw khawm chu a nuin zakawfuol chîn a ṭhuipêk a, kum tina an inthâwina inhlân dinga a pasal kuoma a fe ve hin a chawipêk hlak a.

en: And Eli blessed Elkanah and his wife, and said, Jehovah give thee seed of this woman for the petition which was asked of Jehovah. And they went unto their own home.
hmr: Chun, Eli chun Elkana le a nu- hmei chu mal a sâwmpêk a, “LALPA ta dinga in thilinhlân in inhlân hi, hi nuhmei thla hin LALPA chun thung raw se cheu,” a ta. Chuongchun, in tieng an fe tah a.

en: And Jehovah visited Hannah, and she conceived, and bare three sons and two daughters. And the child Samuel grew before Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Hanna chu a hung sir a, nau a vawn a, naupasal pathum le naunuhmei pahni a nei a. Chun, naupang Samuel chu LALPA hmaa chun a hung inṭhanglien tah a.

en: Now Eli was very old; and he heard all that his sons did unto all Israel, and how that they lay with the women that did service at the door of the tent of meeting.
hmr: Eli chu a hung tar ta hle el a; Israel mihai po po chunga a nauhai thilthaw po po le inbiekna puon in kawtkhâr bula rawngbâwltu nuhmei- hai an lo zâlpui hlak thu dâm a lo hriet a.

en: And he said unto them, Why do ye such things? for I hear of your evil dealings from all this people.
hmr: Chuongchun, an kuomah, “Iengdinga hieng ang thil hi in thaw am a na? Mi po pohaia inthawk hin in thilthaw ṭha nawhai chu ka lo hriet a nih.

en: Nay, my sons; for it is no good report that I hear: ye make Jehovah’s people to transgress.
hmr: Ni lo, ka naupasalhai, in chanchin ka lo hriet hi a ṭha naw tieng ruok a nih; LALPA mihai chu in inbawsiettir a nih.

en: If one man sin against another, God shall judge him; but if a man sin against Jehovah, who shall entreat for him? Notwithstanding, they hearkened not unto the voice of their father, because Jehovah was minded to slay them.
hmr: Mi pakhat mi dang chunga a suol chu Pathienin rorêlpêk a ta, amiruokchu mi, LALPA chungah a suol ruok chun tuin am ngênpui tâng a ta?” a ta. Chuong sa khawm chun an pa râwl chu an ngai nuom nawh a, LALPA chun anni chu a sukhlum ngei ding a ni sih a.

en: And the child Samuel grew on, and increased in favor both with Jehovah, and also with men.
hmr: Chun, naupang Samuel chu ân ṭhanglien deu deu a, Pathien le mihriemhai dit zâwngin a um tah a.

en: And there came a man of God unto Eli, and said unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, Did I reveal myself unto the house of thy father, when they were in Egypt in bondage to Pharaoh’s house?
hmr: Chun, Eli kuoma chun Pathien mi pakhat a hung a, a kuomah, “LALPA chun hieng ang hin a tih, ‘Aigupta rama Pharao suoka an um lai khan in thlatu kuoma khan kân lâr a ni naw am a nih?

en: and did I choose him out of all the tribes of Israel to be my priest, to go up unto mine altar, to burn incense, to wear an ephod before me? and did I give unto the house of thy father all the offerings of the children of Israel made by fire?
hmr: Chun, Israel hnam po po laia ka mâichâma hang fe a, riminhnik raw a, ka hmaa zakawsîng hâk dingin ka thiempu dingin ama chu ka ruot a ni naw am a nih? I thlatuhai chu Israel mihai pumrawhmang thil inhlân po po ka pêk a ni naw am a nih?

en: Wherefore kick ye at my sacrifice and at mine offering, which I have commanded in my habitation, and honorest thy sons above me, to make yourselves fat with the chiefest of all the offerings of Israel my people?
hmr: Ieng leiin am ka umnaa inhlân dinga ka ruot ka kuoma inthâwina le ka puola thil inhlân chu in sirde a, keia nêka i nauhai i chawimawi lem a, nangni insukthâuna dinga ka mi Israelhai inthâwina a ṭha ṭha in hmang am a na?’ tiin.

en: Therefore Jehovah, the God of Israel, saith, I said indeed that thy house, and the house of thy father, should walk before me for ever: but now Jehovah saith, Be it far from me; for them that honor me I will honor, and they that despise me shall be lightly esteemed.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA Israelhai Pathien chun, ‘Kei chun chu i sûnghai le i pa sûnghai chu kumkhuoin ka hmaah um in tih’ ka ti ngei a; nisienlakhawm, tuhin LALPA chun, ‘Um naw tawp in tih, a mi chawimawi taphawt chu chawimawi ka ta, a mi hmusit taphawt chu ka ngainêp an ni ding a ni sih a.

en: Behold, the days come, that I will cut off thine arm, and the arm of thy father’s house, that there shall not be an old man in thy house.
hmr: Ngai ta, i bân dâm, i pa sûng- hai bân dâm ka tan ni ding chu a hung tlung ding a ni tah; i inah tarkûna dam hrim hrim um naw ni hai.

en: And thou shalt behold the affliction of my habitation, in all the wealth which God shall give Israel; and there shall not be an old man in thy house for ever.
hmr: Pathienin Israelhai chu hauna a pêk pha chun nang chun ka umnaa tuorna la hmûng i ta; chun, i ina chun kumkhawtluongin tarkûna dam hrim hrim um naw ni hai.

en: And the man of thine, whom I shall not cut off from mine altar, shall be to consume thine eyes, and to grieve thy heart; and all the increase of thy house shall die in the flower of their age.
hmr: Chun, i mi, ka mâichâma inthawka ka sukbohmang naw ding hai chu i mit sukkhamtu le I lungril suknatu nîng an ta; i ina hung pienghai taphawt chu an vânglai takin thi pei an tih.

en: And this shall be the sign unto thee, that shall come upon thy two sons, on Hophni and Phinehas: in one day they shall die both of them.
hmr: Chun, hi hi, i naupasalhai pahni Hophni le Phinehas chunga thil hung tlung ding chu i ta dingin inchikna nîng a tih; ni khat sûngin an pahniin thi ve vêng an tih.

en: And I will raise me up a faithful priest, that shall do according to that which is in my heart and in my mind: and I will build him a sure house; and he shall walk before mine anointed for ever.
hmr: Chun, thiempu ringumtak ka ta dingin indin ṭha nâwk ka ta, ama chun chu ka lungril le ka lung tuok- zâwngin thâwng a tih. Chun, sûng- kuo dettakah inngîr ka ta, kum- khuoin ka hriek nâl hmaa chun um a tih.

en: And it shall come to pass, that every one that is left in thy house shall come and bow down to him for a piece of silver and a loaf of bread, and shall say, Put me, I pray thee, into one of the priests’ offices, that I may eat a morsel of bread.
hmr: Chun, i ina la um po pohai chu tangka le bei hni dingin fêng an ta, ama chibai bûk an tih, bei tlâwmte bêk ka hmu theina dingin thiempu sin mîn thawtir raw khai, tîng an tih,’ a ti a nih,” a ta.

en: And David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said before Jonathan, What have I done? what is mine iniquity? and what is my sin before thy father, that he seeketh my life?
hmr: Chun, David chu Rama khuoa Naiotha inthawk chu a tlân a, Jonathan kuoma chun a feh a, “Ieng am ka thaw leh? Ieng am ka bawsiet a? i pa chunga hin ieng am ka suksuol a hienga mi that tum a na?” a ta.

en: And he said unto him, Far from it; thou shalt not die: behold, my father doeth nothing either great or small, but that he discloseth it unto me; and why should my father hide this thing from me? it is not so.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “That lo e a, thi naw tawp i tih, ngai ta, ka pa hin mîn hriettir loin, iengkhawm, lien sien chîn sien, a thaw ngai nawh a, ieng- dingin am hieng thu hi ka kuomah ip hlak a ta? ip naw tawp a tih,” a ta.

en: And David sware moreover, and said, Thy father knoweth well that I have found favor in thine eyes; and he saith, Let not Jonathan know this, lest he be grieved: but truly as Jehovah liveth, and as thy soul liveth, there is but a step between me and death.
hmr: Chun, David chun, “I pa chun i mi lunginsiet dân hi a hriet chieng hle el sih a. ‘Jonathan chun hi hi chu hre kher da raw se, chuong naw chun, a lungngai âwm êm el,’ a ti nîng a tih. Amiruokchu, LALPA hringna le i hringna sâlin ka hril a nih, thina le kan inkâr chu pên khat chau a nih,” tiin a hril uor nâwk a.

en: Then said Jonathan unto David, Whatsoever thy soul desireth, I will even do it for thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jonathan chun David kuomah, “I hringnain a dit ang taphawt chun thawpêk pei ka ti che,” a ta.

en: And David said unto Jonathan, Behold, to-morrow is the new moon, and I should not fail to sit with the king at meat: but let me go, that I may hide myself in the field unto the third day at even.
hmr: David chun Jonathan kuomah, “Ngai ta, zinga hin thla thar a ni ding a na, lal kuoma thlaithlêng awt ngei ding ka na, nisienlakhawm, a ni thum ni zântieng chenin phûl tieng inbi- hmang dingin fe lem ka tih.

en: If thy father miss me at all, then say, David earnestly asked leave of me that he might run to Beth-lehem his city; for it is the yearly sacrifice there for all the family.
hmr: I pa chun ka um naw hi hung hre suok a ni hlau chun, ‘David chun a khuo Bethlehema va fe vak dingin a mi hni a mi hnih a, an sûngkaw ta dinga an kum tin inthâwi hun a na,’ lo ti la.

en: If he say thus, It is well; thy servant shall have peace: but if he be wroth, then know that evil is determined by him.
hmr: ‘A ṭha chu,’ a ti chun, i siehlaw chu a lung muong a ta, amiruokchu, a lung a sen chun thil ṭha naw thaw a tum a nih ti hre el rawh.

en: Therefore deal kindly with thy servant; for thou hast brought thy servant into a covenant of Jehovah with thee: but if there be in me iniquity, slay me thyself; for why shouldest thou bring me to thy father?
hmr: Chuleiin, i siehlaw hi ṭhatakin thaw la, i siehlaw chu LALPA thu- thlungah i lûtpui ta sih a; amiruok- chu, bawsietna nei ka ni chun nangin mi that law law el rawh, iengdingin am i pa kuoma chun mi ṭhuoi kher kher i ta?” a ta.

en: And Jonathan said, Far be it from thee; for if I should at all know that evil were determined by my father to come upon thee, then would not I tell it thee?
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun, “That lo e a, i chunga thil ṭha naw thaw ka pain a tum ka hriet phawt chun ka hril naw ding che am a nih?” a ta.

en: Then said David to Jonathan, Who shall tell me if perchance thy father answer thee roughly?
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Jona- than kuomah, “I pa hin inrawmtakin dawn ta ang sienla che, tuin am mi hril a ta?” a ta.

en: And Jonathan said unto David, Come, and let us go out into the field. And they went out both of them into the field.
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun David kuomah, “Hung ta, va fêng ei tih,” a ta. Chuongchun, phûla chun an va fe rêl tah a.

en: And Jonathan said unto David, Jehovah, the God of Israel, be witness: when I have sounded my father about this time to-morrow, or the third day, behold, if there be good toward David, shall I not then send unto thee, and disclose it unto thee?
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun David kuomah, “LALPA Israelhai Pathien chu hretu ni raw se, zîngah hieng tik pha hin amanih, ni thum nia manih, ka pa ka hung dâwp pha, ngai ta, David chungchâng thu hi ṭha tieng a ni chun mi hung tirin ka hril el naw ding che?

en: Jehovah do so to Jonathan, and more also, should it please my father to do thee evil, if I disclose it not unto thee, and send thee away, that thou mayest go in peace: and Jehovah be with thee, as he hath been with my father.
hmr: Chun, ka pain i chungah thil ṭha naw thaw nuom ta sienla, ka hril naw cheh a, lungmuongtaka i fe theina dinga kân thla naw che chun, LALPAIN Jonathan chu a thaw thawin thaw sienla, chu nêka nasa khawmin; chun, LALPA chu i kuom- ah um raw se, ka pa kuoma a um hlak angin.

en: And thou shalt not only while yet I live show me the lovingkindness of Jehovah, that I die not;
hmr: Chun, ka thi nawna dingin ka dam sûng chaua LALPA lunginsietna mîn hmutir ni loin,

en: but also thou shalt not cut off thy kindness from my house for ever; no, not when Jehovah hath cut off the enemies of David every one from the face of the earth.
hmr: kumkhawtluongin ka sûnghai chunga khawm i lunginsietna chu bo naw raw se; LALPAIN David hmêlma hnuoi chunga a sukbo vawng hnung chen khawmin ma naw rawh,” a ta.

en: So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David, saying, And Jehovah will require it at the hand of David’s enemies.
hmr: Jonathan chun, “David hmêl- mahaia inthawkin LALPA chun phût a tih,” tiin David sûnghai kuoma chun thu a thlung a.

en: And Jonathan caused David to swear again, for the love that he had to him; for he loved him as he loved his own soul.
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun ama a hmangaina sâlin David kuoma chun ṭawng ân khâm nâwk a, ama hring- na a hmangai ang chiein a hmangai sih a.

en: Then Jonathan said unto him, To-morrow is the new moon: and thou wilt be missed, because thy seat will be empty.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jonathan chun a kuomah, “Zinga hin thla thar a ni ding a na, i ṭhungna hmun a ruok ding leiin i um naw chu inlang ngei ding a na.

en: And when thou hast stayed three days, thou shalt go down quickly, and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself when the business was in hand, and shalt remain by the stone Ezel.
hmr: Ni thum i um hnung chun fe thla vat la, kha hmaa thil a hung um laia în bîkna hmuna khan hung la, Ezel lung bula chun um zing rawh.

en: And I will shoot three arrows on the side thereof, as though I shot at a mark.
hmr: Chun, inthemthiem ni âwmtak- in a sîrah thal pathum hung kâp ka ta.

en: And, behold, I will send the lad, saying, Go, find the arrows. If I say unto the lad, Behold, the arrows are on this side of thee; take them, and come; for there is peace to thee and no hurt, as Jehovah liveth.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, ‘Fe la, thalhai kha va zawng hmu rawh,’ tiin nau- pang tir ka ta. Naupang kuoma chun, ‘En ta, thalhai chu i hnungtienga kha a um ie, la la, hung rawh,’ ka ti chun, LALPA hringna sâlin ka hril a, i ta dingin muong a umin ṭi ding a um naw nîng a ta.

en: But if I say thus unto the boy, Behold, the arrows are beyond thee; go thy way; for Jehovah hath sent thee away.
hmr: Amiruokchu, naupang kuoma chun, ‘En ta, thalhai chu i khêltienga saw a um,’ ka ti chun, fe hmang el rawh; LALPA chun ân fe hmangtir che ning a tih.

en: And as touching the matter which thou and I have spoken of, behold, Jehovah is between thee and me for ever.
hmr: Chun, nang le keiin thil ei hril tahai chungchâng thua chun ngai ta, nang le ei inkâra chun LALPA chu a um kumkhuo a nih,” a ta.

en: So David hid himself in the field: and when the new moon was come, the king sat him down to eat food.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu phûla chun ân bihmang a, chun, thla a hung thar chun lal chu thlaithlêng awtin a ṭhung a.

en: And the king sat upon his seat, as at other times, even upon the seat by the wall; and Jonathan stood up, and Abner sat by Saul’s side: but David’s place was empty.
hmr: Lal chu ni danga a ṭhungna pângngai bang kâwla a ṭhungnaa chun a ṭhung a; chun, Jonathan chu a ngîr a; chun, Abner chu Saula kâwla chun a ṭhung a; David hmun ruok kha chu a ruok a.

en: Nevertheless Saul spake not anything that day: for he thought, Something hath befallen him, he is not clean; surely he is not clean.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Saula chun chu ni chun iengkhawm a hril nawh a, “A chungah thil ieng am a nih a um a, ân thieng naw amanih ning a ta, a thieng naw ni ngei a tih,” a ti lungril a.

en: And it came to pass on the morrow after the new moon, which was the second day, that David’s place was empty: and Saul said unto Jonathan his son, Wherefore cometh not the son of Jesse to meat, neither yesterday, nor to-day?
hmr: Chun, thla thar a ni hni ni chun David hmun chu a la ruok ta rawp a; chuongchun, Saula chun a naupa Jonathan kuomah, “Iengdinga Jesai naupa hi zâni le vawisûn hin thlai- thlêng awt dinga hung naw am a na?” a ta.

en: And Jonathan answered Saul, David earnestly asked leave of me to go to Beth-lehem:
hmr: Jonathan chun Saula chu a dawn a, “David chun Bethlehema fe dingin a mi hni a mi hni a.

en: and he said, Let me go, I pray thee; for our family hath a sacrifice in the city; and my brother, he hath commanded me to be there: and now, if I have found favor in thine eyes, let me get away, I pray thee, and see my brethren. Therefore he is not come unto the king’s table.
hmr: ‘Mîn fetir hrâm rawh khai, kan sûngkuo chun khuoa chun inthâwina an nei ding a na, ka unaupa chun um ve dingin a mîn cha tlat a; chuong- chun, i mi lunginsiet thei chun mîn fetir la, ka unauhai va sir ka tih,’ a ta. Chu lei chun lal dawkâna chun a hung naw a nih,” a ta.

en: Then Saul’s anger was kindled against Jonathan, and he said unto him, Thou son of a perverse rebellious woman, do not I know that thou hast chosen the son of Jesse to thine own shame, and unto the shame of thy mother’s nakedness?
hmr: Chuongchun, Jonathan chung- ah Saula lung chu a sen ta thut el a, “Nang nuhmei lepchie le kâwmaw naupa, Jesai naupa chu i muolphona dingin le i nu saruokna sukmuol- phona dingin i thlang ti ka hriet naw am a nih?

en: For as long as the son of Jesse liveth upon the ground, thou shalt not be established, nor thy kingdom. Wherefore now send and fetch him unto me, for he shall surely die.
hmr: Jesai naupa hi, hi hnuoia a um sûng phawt chun sukdet ni naw ti nih a, i ram khawm. Chuleiin, inkotir nghâl la, ka kuomah hung inṭhuoitir rawh, a thi ngei ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And Jonathan answered Saul his father, and said unto him, Wherefore should he be put to death? what hath he done?
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun a pa Saula chu a dawn a, a kuomah, “Ieng- dingin am sukhlum ding nîng a ta? Ieng am a thaw hrim leh?” a ta.

en: And Saul cast his spear at him to smite him; whereby Jonathan knew that it was determined of his father to put David to death.
hmr: Saula chun khaw tumin a fei chu a hang inlet a; chu chu lei chun Jonathan chun a pain David chu that a lo tum ngei a ni ti a hriet tah a.

en: So Jonathan arose from the table in fierce anger, and did eat no food the second day of the month; for he was grieved for David, because his father had done him shame.
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chu dawkâna inthawk chun lunginsentakin a tho a, chu thla ni hni ni chun thlaithlêng a awt ve ta nawh a, a pa chun David a sukmuolpho êm lei chun a lung- ngaipui a nih.

en: And it came to pass in the morning, that Jonathan went out into the field at the time appointed with David, and a little lad with him.
hmr: Chun, zîngkâr chun Jonathan chu naupangte chu ṭhuoiin David le an hmun ruot phûl tieng chun a fe tah a.

en: And he said unto his lad, Run, find now the arrows which I shoot. And as the lad ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.
hmr: Chun, a naupang kuoma chun, “Tlân la, ka thal kâphai hi va zawng raw khai,” a ta. Chun, naupang chu a tlân lai chun a khêl tieng chun thal chu a kâp a.

en: And when the lad was come to the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot, Jonathan cried after the lad, and said, Is not the arrow beyond thee?
hmr: Chun, naupang chun Jonathan thal kâp tlâkna hmun a va tlung chun Jonathan chun naupang chu a ko a, “Thal chu i khêl tienga saw a ni naw am a nih?” a ta.

en: And Jonathan cried after the lad, Make speed, haste, stay not. And Jonathan’s lad gathered up the arrows, and came to his master.
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun nau- pangte chu a ko a, “Hung tlân vak rawh, inhmaw rawh, muong naw rawh,” a ta. Chun, Jonathan nau- pang chun thal chu a rût khâwm a, a pu kuom tienga chun a fe tah a.

en: But the lad knew not anything: only Jonathan and David knew the matter.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, naupang chun iengkhawm a hriet naw a, Jonathan le David chau chun thil umzie chu an hriet a.

en: And Jonathan gave his weapons unto his lad, and said unto him, Go, carry them to the city.
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun a hriem- hreihai chu naupang chu a pêk a, a kuomah, “Fe la, khuoah lo hang fepui rawh,” a ta.

en: And as soon as the lad was gone, David arose out of a place toward the South, and fell on his face to the ground, and bowed himself three times: and they kissed one another, and wept one with another, until David exceeded.
hmr: Chun, naupang chu a fe phingle chun David chu a umna hmun sim- tieng panga inthawk chun a hung tho a, hmaia hnuoi sikin chibai vawi thum a bûk a, chun, an infâwp a, an ṭap rêl a. David ruok chu a zuol bîk a.

en: And Jonathan said to David, Go in peace, forasmuch as we have sworn both of us in the name of Jehovah, saying, Jehovah shall be between me and thee, and between my seed and thy seed, for ever. And he arose and departed: and Jonathan went into the city.
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun David kuomah, “Lungmuongtakin fe raw khai, ‘LALPA chu nang le ei inkâra le ka thlahai le i thlahai kâra chun kumkhuoin um raw se,’ tiin LALPA hmingin ṭawng ei inkhâm hmunkhat ta kha,” a ta. Chuongchun, a tho a, a fe tah a, chun, Jonathan chu khuoa chun a lût tah a.

en: Then came David to Nob to Ahimelech the priest: and Ahimelech came to meet David trembling, and said unto him, Why art thou alone, and no man with thee?
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu Nob khuoa thiempu Ahimelek kuoma chun a feh a, chun, Ahimelek chun inthin pumin David chu a lo tuok a, a kuomah, “Iengtizie am a na, i va mal de, fe pui i nei nawh a?” a lo tih a.

en: And David said unto Ahimelech the priest, The king hath commanded me a business, and hath said unto me, Let no man know anything of the business whereabout I send thee, and what I have commanded thee: and I have appointed the young men to such and such a place.
hmr: David chun, thiempu Ahimelek kuoma chun, “Lalin thil thaw dingin thu a mi pêk a, ka kuomah, ‘Ka thil inthawtir tum che le ka thupêk hrim hrim che hi tukhawma hre naw raw se,’ a ti tlat a; chun, tlangvâlhai lo umna ding hmunhai chu ka ruot a.

en: Now therefore what is under thy hand? give me five loaves of bread in my hand, or whatsoever there is present.
hmr: Chuongchun, ieng ieng am i kutah a um a? Bei tlang nga mi pe la, annawleh, i nei ang taphawt khawm chu,” a ta.

en: And the priest answered David, and said, There is no common bread under my hand, but there is holy bread; if only the young men have kept themselves from women.
hmr: Chun, thiempu chun David chu a dawn a, “Bei narân chu ka nei nawh a, bei inthieng ruok chu ka nei a; tlangvâlhai chu nuhmeia inthawka an insiekieng phawt chun,” a ta.

en: And David answered the priest, and said unto him, Of a truth women have been kept from us about these three days; when I came out, the vessels of the young men were holy, though it was but a common journey; how much more then to-day shall their vessels be holy?
hmr: Chun, David chun thiempu chu a dawn a, a kuomah, “Tuta ni thum sûng hin chu nuhmeia inthawk hrim hrim chu kan insiekieng vawng a nih, ka hung suok ding lai khawm khan tlangvâlhai bûrlebêl chu ân thieng a nih, invâk satlie el kan ni nâka chu; vawisûn lem chu chu an bûrlebêlhai chu a vân thieng nâwkzuol awm de e!” a ta.

en: So the priest gave him holy bread; for there was no bread there but the showbread, that was taken from before Jehovah, to put hot bread in the day when it was taken away.
hmr: Chuongchun, thiempu chun, bei inthieng chu a pêk tah a; chutaka chun entirna bei an lâk nia bei luma thleng dinga LALPA hmaa inthawka an lâk chau naw chu bei dang a um si nawh a.

en: Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, detained before Jehovah; and his name was Doeg the Edomite, the chiefest of the herdsmen that belonged to Saul.
hmr: Chun, chu ni chun Saula siehlaw laia mi pakhat LALPA hmaa hrên a um a, a hming chu Doeg a nih, Edom mi, Saula ran vêngtuhai laia hotu tak a nih.

en: And David said unto Ahimelech, And is there not here under thy hand spear or sword? for I have neither brought my sword nor my weapons with me, because the king’s business required haste.
hmr: Chun, David chun Ahimelek kuoma chun, “Fei amanih, kâwlhnâm amanih i kawl naw maw? Lal hmaa chun inhmaw a ṭûl leiin ka kâwlhnâm le ka hriemhrei a ieng khawm ka hung chawi hman naw a nih,” a ta.

en: And the priest said, The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom thou slewest in the vale of Elah, behold, it is here wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod: if thou wilt take that, take it; for there is no other save that here. And David said, There is none like that; give it me.
hmr: Chun, thiempu chun, “Philistin mi Goliath, Ela ruoma i thatpa kâwlhnâm chu ngai ta, thiempu zakawsîng hliea sawn puona tuomin a um zing el, chu chu i lâk nuom chun la rawh; chu chau naw chu a dang a um nawh,” a ta. David chun, “Chu bâk chu ie, mi pe raw khai,” a ta.

en: And David arose, and fled that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish the king of Gath.
hmr: Chun, David chu a tho a, chu ni chun Saula ṭi chun a tlân hmang a, Gath lal Akis kuomah a fe tah a.

en: And the servants of Achish said unto him, Is not this David the king of the land? did they not sing one to another of him in dances, saying, Saul hath slain his thousands, And David his ten thousands?
hmr: Chun, Akis siehlawhai chun a kuomah, “Hi hi an ram lal David a ni naw am a ni kha? ‘Saulain a sânga sâng a that a, Davidin a sînga sîng a that a,’ tiha lâm pumin a chungchâng thu hlain an sak dur dur a ni naw am a ni kha?” an ta.

en: And David laid up these words in his heart, and was sore afraid of Achish the king of Gath.
hmr: Chun, David chun chuong thuhai chu a lungrilah a pai tah a, Gath lal Akis chu a ṭi ta hle el a.

en: And he changed his behavior before them, and feigned himself mad in their hands, and scrabbled on the doors of the gate, and let his spittle fall down upon his beard.
hmr: Chuongchun, a hmaa chun a um dân a sukdanglam a, an mithmua chun invêt tehlêm a thaw ta rak el a, kawtkhâr dâm chu a kei rak rak a, a khâkhmula dâm chun a chil a sukluong ta neng nung a.

en: Then said Achish unto his servants, Lo, ye see the man is mad; wherefore then have ye brought him to me?
hmr: Chuongchun, Akis chun a siehlawhai kuoma chun, “En ta u, invêt a ni in hriet zing sih a, iengdinga ka kuoma in hung ṭhuoi am a na?

en: Do I lack madmen, that ye have brought this fellow to play the madman in my presence? shall this fellow come into my house?
hmr: Invêt ka tlâksam leiin am a nih hi mi hi ân vêtzie suklang dinga ka hmaa in hung ṭhuoi chu? Ama hi ka inah a hung lût el ding maw?” a ta.

en: David therefore departed thence, and escaped to the cave of Adullam: and when his brethren and all his father’s house heard it, they went down thither to him.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chu chutaka inthawk chu a suok a, Adullam pûkah a tlân tah a; chun, a unauhai le a pa sûngkuohai po poin an lo hriet chun chutaka chun a kuomah an zu feh a.

en: And every one that was in distress, and every one that was in debt, and every one that was discontented, gathered themselves unto him; and he became captain over them: and there were with him about four hundred men.
hmr: Chun, mi lunginzing taphawthai, leibat nei taphawthai, lungninawna nei taphawthai chu a kuomah an fe khâwm a; chuongchun, an hotuah a um tah a, chun a kuoma chun mi za li lai an um tah a.

en: And David went thence to Mizpeh of Moab: and he said unto the king of Moab, Let my father and my mother, I pray thee, come forth, and be with you, till I know what God will do for me.
hmr: Chun, David chu chutaka inthawk chun Moab rama Mizpe-ah a feh a, Moab lal kuoma chun, “Pathien thil mi thawpêk ding ka hriet hmakhat chu ka nu le ka pa hung hai sien, i kuomah lo um raw hai se, ka hni che a nih,” a ta.

en: And he brought them before the king of Moab: and they dwelt with him all the while that David was in the stronghold.
hmr: Chun, Moab lal hmaa chun anni chu a hung ṭhuoi a, kulbînga a um sûng po chun a kuoma chun an um tah a.

en: And the prophet Gad said unto David, Abide not in the stronghold; depart, and get thee into the land of Judah. Then David departed, and came into the forest of Hereth.
hmr: Chun, zâwlnei Gad chun David kuomah, “Kulbînga hin um zing naw rawh, suok la, Judai ramah fe rawh,” a ta. Chuongchun, David chu a suok a, Hereth ramhnuoia chun a lût tah a.

en: And Saul heard that David was discovered, and the men that were with him: now Saul was sitting in Gibeah, under the tamarisk-tree in Ramah, with his spear in his hand, and all his servants were standing about him.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun David le a kuoma umhai chu an hmu tah ti a lo hriet a, Saula chu Gibeaah Rama khuoa tamarisk thing hnuoiah a fei chawiin a ṭhung a; chun, a vêla chun a siehlawhai po po chu an ngîr a.

en: And Saul said unto his servants that stood about him, Hear now, ye Benjamites; will the son of Jesse give every one of you fields and vineyards, will he make you all captains of thousands and captains of hundreds,
hmr: Chun, Saula chun a kâwl vêla ngîr a siehlawhai kuoma chun, “Nangni Benjamin thlahai lo ngai unla, Jesai naupa chun lohai, grêp huonhai pe seng cheuin, a sipai sâng hotuahai, a sipai za hotuahai a siem vawng ding cheu am a nih?

en: that all of you have conspired against me, and there is none that discloseth to me when my son maketh a league with the son of Jesse, and there is none of you that is sorry for me, or discloseth unto me that my son hath stirred up my servant against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?
hmr: in rêngin in mi enbing a, ka naupain Jesai naupa kuoma thu a ithlung ka kuoma suklang hrim hrim in um nawh a, a mi lungngaipui hrim hrim khawm in um nawh a, ka naupain ka siehlaw hi mi do ding le vawisûn ni chen khawma min chân dinga ân fui thu ka kuoma suklang hrim iengdinga in um naw?” a ta.

en: Then answered Doeg the Edomite, who stood by the servants of Saul, and said, I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelech the son of Ahitub.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula siehlawhai kâwla ngîr Edom mi Doeg chun a dawn a, “Jesai naupa chu Nob khuoa Ahitub naupa Ahimelek kuoma a hung ka hmuh a.

en: And he inquired of Jehovah for him, and gave him victuals, and gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine.
hmr: Chun, ama chun LALPA a rawnpêk a, fâk ding a pêk a; chun, Philistin mi Goliath kâwlhnâm a pêk bawk a,” a ta.

en: Then the king sent to call Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and all his father’s house, the priests that were in Nob: and they came all of them to the king.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun Ahitub naupa Ahimelek thiempu le, a pa sûngkuo Nob khuoa thiempu um po po chu ân kotir a; anni chu an rêngin lal kuoma chun an hung a.

en: And Saul said, Hear now, thou son of Ahitub. And he answered, Here I am, my lord.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “Nang Ahitub naupa, lo ngai rawh,” a ta. Ama chun, “Ka lalpa, hitaka hin ka um,” a ta.

en: And Saul said unto him, Why have ye conspired against me, thou and the son of Jesse, in that thou hast given him bread, and a sword, and hast inquired of God for him, that he should rise against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?
hmr: Chun, Saulain a kuomah, “Bei le kâwlhnâm dâm lo pe a, LALPA chu rawnpêkin vawisûn nia a thaw anga mi do ding le min chân dinga ieng- dinga nang le Jesai naupa hin in mi phierrûk am a na?” a ta.

en: Then Ahimelech answered the king, and said, And who among all thy servants is so faithful as David, who is the king’s son-in-law, and is taken into thy council, and is honorable in thy house?
hmr: Chuongchun, Ahimelek chun lal chu a dawn a, “Lal mâkpa, i mi rawntak hlak, in sûngkuo laia mi inzaum David ang hrim hrima mi ringum hi i siehlaw po pohai lai hin tu am a um a?

en: Have I to-day begun to inquire of God for him? be it far from me: let not the king impute anything unto his servant, nor to all the house of my father; for thy servant knoweth nothing of all this, less or more.
hmr: Vawisûn hi Pathien ka biek râwnpêk ṭan ni am a nih? A ni nawh. Lal hin a siehlaw amanih, ka pa sûngkuo hrim hrim hi min tum lul naw raw se, i siehlaw hin hieng thu po po a iengkhawm hi ka hriet naw a nih,” a ta.

en: And the king said, Thou shalt surely die, Ahimelech, thou, and all thy father’s house.
hmr: Chun, lal chun, “Ahimelek, i thi ngei ngei ding a nih, nang le i pa sûngkuohai po po leh,” a ta.

en: And the king said unto the guard that stood about him, Turn, and slay the priests of Jehovah; because their hand also is with David, and because they knew that he fled, and did not disclose it to me. But the servants of the king would not put forth their hand to fall upon the priests of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a kâwla ngîr sipai kuoma chun, “Nghakîr unla, LALPA thiempuhai hi that ro, David tieng an ṭhang a, a tlân hmang a nih ti hre zing siin ka kuoma an hril naw leiin,” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, lal sie- hlawhai chun LALPA thiempuhai thaw ding chun kut an inlet nuom nawh a.

en: And the king said to Doeg, Turn thou, and fall upon the priests. And Doeg the Edomite turned, and he fell upon the priests, and he slew on that day fourscore and five persons that did wear a linen ephod.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Doeg kuoma chun, “Nang nghakîr la, thiempuhai kha thaw rawh,” a ta. Edom mi Doeg chu a nghakîr a, thiempuhai chu a thawh a, chu ni chun puon zai inhmi sil thiempu zakawsîng hâk, mi sâwmriet le panga a that a.

en: And Nob, the city of the priests, smote he with the edge of the sword, both men and women, children and sucklings, and oxen and asses and sheep, with the edge of the sword.
hmr: Chun, Nob, thiempu khuo chu kâwlhnâmin a thawh a, a nuhmei a pasalin naupang le nênê ne lai chen- in, bâwnghai, sabengtunghai, berâm- hai leh kâwlhnâmin a sât hlum a.

en: And one of the sons of Ahimelech, the son of Ahitub, named Abiathar, escaped, and fled after David.
hmr: Chun, Ahitub naupa Ahimelek naupasalhai laia pakhat a hming Abiathar chu a tlân suok a, David kuomah a tlân a.

en: And Abiathar told David that Saul had slain Jehovah’s priests.
hmr: Chun, Abiathar chun Saulain LALPA thiempuhai a that thu chu David a hril a.

en: And David said unto Abiathar, I knew on that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul: I have occasioned the death of all the persons of thy father’s house.
hmr: David chun Abiathar kuoma chun, “Edom mi Doeg chutaka a um ni ngei khan Saula hril ngei ngei a tih ti ka hriet sa hrim a nih; I pa sûng- kuohai po po chu keia leia thi an nih.

en: Abide thou with me, fear not; for he that seeketh my life seeketh thy life: for with me thou shalt be in safeguard.
hmr: Nang chu ka kuomah um la ṭi naw rawh; kei mi that tum chun nang khawm that tum ngei an ti che; ka kuoma i um ruok chun chu him i tih,” a ta.

en: And they told David, saying, Behold, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and are robbing the threshing-floors.
hmr: Chun, “Ngai ta, Philistin mihai chun Keila khuo an thawh a, hrizâwla buhai chu an lâkpêk vawng el,” tiin David chu an hril a.

en: Therefore David inquired of Jehovah, saying, Shall I go and smite these Philistines? And Jehovah said unto David, Go, and smite the Philistines, and save Keilah.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun LALPA chu, “Chuong Philistin mihai chu ka zu thaw ding am a nih?” tiin a râwn a. LALPA chun David kuomah, “Philis- tin mihai chu zu thaw la, Keila khuo chu zu sanhim rawh,” a ta.

en: And David’s men said unto him, Behold, we are afraid here in Judah: how much more then if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?
hmr: Chun, David mihai chun a kuom- ah, “Ngai ta, Judai rama um zing khawm hin ei ṭi a na, Keila khuoa zu feh a, Philistin sipaihai zu do chu ṭi a va um nâwkzuol âwm de!” an ta.

en: Then David inquired of Jehovah yet again. And Jehovah answered him, and said, Arise, go down to Keilah; for I will deliver the Philistines into thy hand.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun LALPA chu a râwn nâwk tah a. Chun, LALPA chun a dawn a, a kuomah, “Tho la, Keila khuoah zu fe thla rawh, Philistin mihai chu i kutah pêng ka tih,” a ta.

en: And David and his men went to Keilah, and fought with the Philistines, and brought away their cattle, and slew them with a great slaughter. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.
hmr: Chuongchun, David le a mihai chu Keila khuoa chun an zu fe tah a, Philistin mihai chu an zu thawh a, an ranhai chu an lâkpêk a, an that ṭeu a. Chuong ang chun David chun Keila khuoa mihai chu a humhim tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, that he came down with an ephod in his hand.
hmr: Chun, Ahimelek naupa Abiathar Keila khuoa David kuoma a tlân lai khan thiempu zakawsîng chawia fe thla a na.

en: And it was told Saul that David was come to Keilah. And Saul said, God hath delivered him into my hand; for he is shut in, by entering into a town that hath gates and bars.
hmr: Chun, Keila khuoa chun David chu a fe ti Saula an hril a, Saula chun, “Pathienin ka kutah a mi pêk a ni ta chu, kul kawtkhâr le a kalna nei khuoa chun lûtin ân khum ta sih a,” a ta.

en: And Saul summoned all the people to war, to go down to Keilah, to besiege David and his men.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun mi po po chu indo dingin, Keila khuoa chun zu fe a, David le a mihai zûn huol dingin a ko khâwm a.

en: And David knew that Saul was devising mischief against him; and he said to Abiathar the priest, Bring hither the ephod.
hmr: David chun Saula chun a chunga thil ṭha naw a ngaituo ti chu a lo hriet a, thiempu Abiathar kuoma chun, “Thiempu zakawsîng kha hung la ta khai,” a ta.

en: Then said David, O Jehovah, the God of Israel, thy servant hath surely heard that Saul seeketh to come to Keilah, to destroy the city for my sake.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun, “Aw LALPA, Israelhai Pathien, i siehlaw hin Saula chun keima leia khuo chu sukse dingin, Keila khuoa hin hung thlâk a tum ti ka hriet tlat a.

en: Will the men of Keilah deliver me up into his hand? will Saul come down, as thy servant hath heard? O Jehovah, the God of Israel, I beseech thee, tell thy servant. And Jehovah said, He will come down.
hmr: Keila khuoa mihai hin a kuta chun an mi pêk el ding am a nih? I siehlawin ka lo hriet ang chun Saula chu a hung thla ding am a nih? Aw LALPA, Israelhai Pathien, ka hni che a nih, i siehlaw hi hung hril rawh,” a ta. Chun, LALPA chun, “A hung thla ding a nih,” a ta.

en: Then said David, Will the men of Keilah deliver up me and my men into the hand of Saul? And Jehovah said, They will deliver thee up.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun, “Keila khuoa mihai chun kei le ka mihai hi Saula kutah an mi pêk el ding am a nih?” a ta. Chun, LALPA chun, “Pêng an ti che,” a ta.

en: Then David and his men, who were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went whithersoever they could go. And it was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he forbare to go forth.
hmr: Chuongchun, David le a mihai za ruk lai chu an tho a, Keila khuoa inthawk chu an suok a, fena rem- châng natieng poa chun an fe tah a. Chun, David chu Keila khuoa inthawkin a tlân suok tah ti Saula an hril a; chuongchun, inthawk suok chu a ṭhul tah a.

en: And David abode in the wilderness in the strongholds, and remained in the hill-country in the wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought him every day, but God delivered him not into his hand.
hmr: Chun, David chu thlalêrah, kul- bîng nghettakahai a um a, Ziph thlalêr tlâng ramah a um ta zing a. Chun, Saula chun ama chu ni tin hin a zawng a, nisienlakhawm, Pathienin a kutah a pêk nawh.

en: And David saw that Saul was come out to seek his life: and David was in the wilderness of Ziph in the wood.
hmr: Chun, David chun ama suk- hlum tumin Saula chu a hung inthawk ti a hriet a; chuongchun, David chu Ziph thlalêr Horeshah a um a.

en: And Jonathan, Saul’s son, arose, and went to David into the wood, and strengthened his hand in God.
hmr: Chun, Saula naupa Jonathan chu a tho a, Horeshah David kuoma chun a feh a. Pathienah a kut chu a sukhrâtpêk a.

en: And he said unto him, Fear not; for the hand of Saul my father shall not find thee; and thou shalt be king over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee; and that also Saul my father knoweth.
hmr: Chun, a kuomah, “Ṭi dêr naw rawh, ka pa Saula kut chun zawng suok naw ni che; Israelhai lalah um i ta, kei nanga dawt nîng ka tih, chu khawm chu ka pa Saula hin a hriet zing a nih,” a ta. Chun, an pahni chun LALPA hmaa thu an thlung a;

en: And they two made a covenant before Jehovah: and David abode in the wood, and Jonathan went to his house.
hmr: David chu Horesha chun a um zing a; Jonathan ruok chu in tieng a fe tah a.

en: Then came up the Ziphites to Saul to Gibeah, saying, Doth not David hide himself with us in the strongholds in the wood, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the south of the desert?
hmr: Chuongchun, Ziph mihai chu Gibea-ah Saula kuomah an hang feh a, “David chu kan kuomah Horesha kulbîngah, thlalêr simtieng pang Hakila tlângah ân bihmang zing a ni naw am a nih?

en: Now therefore, O king, come down, according to all the desire of thy soul to come down; and our part shall be to deliver him up into the king’s hand.
hmr: Chuleiin, aw lalpa, i hringnain hung thlâk a duthusâm ang ngei chun hung thla ta la, chun, keini lo thaw ve ding chu lal kuta ama lo inhlân chu nîng a ta,” an ta.

en: And Saul said, Blessed be ye of Jehovah; for ye have had compassion on me.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun, “LALPA chun malsâwm raw se cheu; nangni chun chu in mi lunginsiet hle a ni hi.

en: Go, I pray you, make yet more sure, and know and see his place where his haunt is, and who hath seen him there; for it is told me that he dealeth very subtly.
hmr: Fe unla, va sukchieng nâwkzuol unla, a hnung le hma va sui unla, chutaka a hmutu khawm va sukfel nâwkzuol zet zet ro: var vervêktakin thil a thaw hlak a nih ti miin an mi hril a nih.
