en: And she said, The glory is departed from Israel; for the ark of God is taken.
hmr: “Ropuina chun Israel chu a suoksan tah a, Pathien bâwm chu an lâkpêk ta sih a,” a ta.

en: Now the Philistines had taken the ark of God, and they brought it from Eben-ezer unto Ashdod.
hmr: Chuongchun, Philistin mihai chun Pathien bâwm chu an lâk a, Ebenezera inthawk chun Asdod khuoah an fepui tah a.

en: And the Philistines took the ark of God, and brought it into the house of Dagon, and set it by Dagon.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai chun Pathien bâwm chu an lâk a, Dagon biekna inah an lâklût a, Dagon kâwla chun an sieh a.

en: And when they of Ashdod arose early on the morrow, behold, Dagon was fallen upon his face to the ground before the ark of Jehovah. And they took Dagon, and set him in his place again.
hmr: Chun, Asdod khuoa mihai chun a zînga zîngkâr an hang tho chun, ngai ta, LALPA bâwm hmaa chun Dagon chu a hmaia hnuoi sikin a lo tlu dêr el a. Chun, Dagon chu an lâk a, a umna hmuna chun an sie nâwk a.

en: And when they arose early on the morrow morning, behold, Dagon was fallen upon his face to the ground before the ark of Jehovah; and the head of Dagon and both the palms of his hands lay cut off upon the threshold; only the stump of Dagon was left to him.
hmr: Chun, a zîngnâwk zîngkâr an hang tho chun, ngai ta, LALPA bâwm hmaa chun Dagon chu a hmaia hnuoi sikin a lo tlu dêr el a; Dagon lu le a kutpha bâwr khing hni bawng chu kawtkhâr bula chun a lo inhlum ngul el a; Dagon chu a taksa chau a lo um el tah a.

en: Therefore neither the priests of Dagon, nor any that come into Dagon’s house, tread on the threshold of Dagon in Ashdod, unto this day.
hmr: Chu chu lei chun Dagon thiempu amanih, Dagon biekna ina hung hlakhai hrim hrim khawmin Asdod khuoa Dagon kawtkhâr bul chu tu chen khawm hin an la sir ngam naw a nih.

en: But the hand of Jehovah was heavy upon them of Ashdod, and he destroyed them, and smote them with tumors, even Ashdod and the borders thereof.
hmr: LALPA kut chun Asdod khuoa mihai chu a del ta hle el a, sietna ân tlungtirpêk tâwl tah a, Asdod khuo le a vêl khuohai chu ngâwtin a hrem ta bawk a.

en: And when the men of Ashdod saw that it was so, they said, The ark of the God of Israel shall not abide with us; for his hand is sore upon us, and upon Dagon our god.
hmr: Chuongchun, Asdod khuoa mi- haiin chuong ang chu a nih ti an lo hrietin, “Israelhai Pathien bâwm hi ei kuoma hin um zing da raw se ie, ei chunga le ei pathien Dagon chunga a kutthlâk a na em el,” an ta.

en: They sent therefore and gathered all the lords of the Philistines unto them, and said, What shall we do with the ark of the God of Israel? And they answered, Let the ark of the God of Israel be carried about unto Gath. And they carried the ark of the God of Israel thither.
hmr: Chuongchun, Philistin lal po pohai chu an kuomah an ko khâwm a, “Israelhai Pathien bâwm hi iengtin am ei thaw ding a na?” an ta. Anni chun, “Israelhai Pathien bâwm chu Gath khuoah va fepui ro,” tiin an dawn a; chuongchun, Israelhai Pathien bâwm chu an va fepui tah a.

en: And it was so, that, after they had carried it about, the hand of Jehovah was against the city with a very great discomfiture: and he smote the men of the city, both small and great; and tumors brake out upon them.
hmr: Chun, chuonga an fetlungpui chun, LALPA kut chun khuo chu a hung sukbuoi tah a, khuoa mi- hriemhai chu a chîn a lienin a hrem a, ngâwtna hri an chungah ân lêngtir a.

en: So they sent the ark of God to Ekron. And it came to pass, as the ark of God came to Ekron, that the Ekronites cried out, saying, They have brought about the ark of the God of Israel to us, to slay us and our people.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathien bâwm chu Ekronah an infetir a. Pathien bâwm chun Ekron a va tlung chun, Ekron khuoa mihai chu, “Israel- hai Pathien bâwm chu eini le ei mihai sukhlum dingin ei kuomah an hung lâk tah,” tiin an khêk ta rak el a.

en: They sent therefore and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines, and they said, Send away the ark of the God of Israel, and let it go again to its own place, that it slay us not, and our people. For there was a deadly discomfiture throughout all the city; the hand of God was very heavy there.
hmr: Chuongchun, Philistin lalhai po po chu an ko khâwm a, “Israelhai Pathien bâwm hi infe hmangtir unla keini le kan mihai a mi sukhlum nawna dingin a umna hmun pângngaiah fe nâwk raw se,” an ta. Khaw pumpuia chun thina khawp buoina nasatak a um a; Pathien kut chun chu khuo chu a del hle sih a.

en: And the men that died not were smitten with the tumors; and the cry of the city went up to heaven.
hmr: A thi nawhai khawm chu ngâwtin an na tâwl a; chuongchun, chu khaw khêkri chun vân khi a hang tlung a.

en: And the ark of Jehovah was in the country of the Philistines seven months.
hmr: LALPA bâwm chu Philistin mihai rama chun thla sari a um a.

en: And the Philistines called for the priests and the diviners, saying, What shall we do with the ark of Jehovah? show us wherewith we shall send it to its place.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai chun, “LALPA bâwm hi iengtin am thâwng ei ta? A umna pângngaia infetir nâwkna dân ding mi hril ta u khai,” tiin thiempuhai le aisânthiemhai an ko a.

en: And they said, If ye send away the ark of the God of Israel, send it not empty; but by all means return him a trespass-offering: then ye shall be healed, and it shall be known to you why his hand is not removed from you.
hmr: Anni chun, “Israelhai Pathien bâwm hi infetir ding in ni khawma a ruok chun infetir dêr naw ro, a kuomah bâwsietna inthâwina inhlân ngei ro, chuongchun, sukdamin um in ta, chun, iengtiziea a kut chu a sawnpêk naw cheu am a na ti hrieng in tih,” an ta.

en: Then said they, What shall be the trespass-offering which we shall return to him? And they said, Five golden tumors, and five golden mice, according to the number of the lords of the Philistines; for one plague was on you all, and on your lords.
hmr: Chun, anni chun, “A kuoma kan bawsietna inthâwina inhlân ding chu ieng am nîng a ta?” an ta. Anni chun, “Philistin lalhai zâtin rângkachak ngâwt lim panga le rângkachak chaichene lim panga, in rênga chunga hri inlêng le in lalhai chunga inlêng chu hmunkhat a ni sih a.

en: Wherefore ye shall make images of your tumors, and images of your mice that mar the land; and ye shall give glory unto the God of Israel: peradventure he will lighten his hand from off you, and from off your gods, and from off your land.
hmr: Chuleiin, in ngâwt limhai le in ram suksetu chaichene lim chu siem unla; chun, Israelhai Pathien chu chawimawi ro; chuongchun, a kut chu in chunga dâm, in pathien chunga dâm, in ram chunga dâm sukzâng nuom rawi naw nîm.

en: Wherefore then do ye harden your hearts, as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts? When he had wrought wonderfully among them, did they not let the people go, and they departed?
hmr: Aigupta mihai le Pharaoin lung- ril an sukngar ang khan iengdinga in lungril in sukngar am a na? Anni laia thil maktaka a thaw khan anni kha ân fetir a, an suok a nih naw am a nih?

en: Now therefore take and prepare you a new cart, and two milch kine, on which there hath come no yoke; and tie the kine to the cart, and bring their calves home from them;
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin tawlailîr thar buotsai unla, bâwngpui pahni a nêne sâwr lai, rîngkawl lân bâttir ngailo chu bel unla; chun, an têhai chu in tieng hung ṭhuoipêk ro.

en: and take the ark of Jehovah, and lay it upon the cart; and put the jewels of gold, which ye return him for a trespass-offering, in a coffer by the side thereof; and send it away, that it may go.
hmr: Chun, LALPA bâwm chu la unla, tawlailîra chun sie unla, chun, baw- siet thilînhlâna in inhlân rângkachak thil hlu chu thingrema khumin a sîr- ah sie unla, infetir unla, inthla el ro.

en: And see; if it goeth up by the way of its own border to Beth-shemesh, then he hath done us this great evil: but if not, then we shall know that it is not his hand that smote us; it was a chance that happened to us.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama ramri tieng lampui hrawin Beth-semesa chun a fe am en ta u; a fe chun ei chunga thil ṭha nawtak hi ama thaw nîng a ta, a fe naw chun a mi hremtu chu ama kut a lo ni nawh ti hrieng ei ta, ei chunga hung um ve hrim hrim nîng a tih,” an tih a.

en: And the men did so, and took two milch kine, and tied them to the cart, and shut up their calves at home;
hmr: Chun, mihai chun chuong ang chun an thawh a, bâwngpui a nêne sâwr lai pahni an ṭhuoi a, tawlailîra chun an bel a, an têhai chu in tieng an khum a;

en: and they put the ark of Jehovah upon the cart, and the coffer with the mice of gold and the images of their tumors.
hmr: Chun, LALPA bâwm chu tawlai- lîra chun an sieh a, rângkachak chaichene lim le ngâwt lim siena thingrem leh.

en: And the kine took the straight way by the way to Beth-shemesh; they went along the highway, lowing as they went, and turned not aside to the right hand or to the left; and the lords of the Philistines went after them unto the border of Beth-shemesh.
hmr: Chun, bâwngpuihai chun Beth- semes tieng panin lam chu an hraw ta ngat ngat a; chuongchun, inbu malam peiin lam tluongpui chu an hrawh a, changtieng amanih, vawitieng ama- nih khawm an pêt dêr nawh a; Philistin lalhai chun Beth-semes ramri chenin an zui a.

en: And they of Beth-shemesh were reaping their wheat harvest in the valley; and they lifted up their eyes, and saw the ark, and rejoiced to see it.
hmr: Chun, Beth-semes khuoa mihai chun ruoma hin an bu an lo sîk a, an hang nghah a, bâwm chu an hang hmuh a, an lâwm ta êm êm a.

en: And the cart came into the field of Joshua the Beth-shemite, and stood there, where there was a great stone: and they clave the wood of the cart, and offered up the kine for a burnt-offering unto Jehovah.
hmr: Tawlailîr chu Beth-semes khuoa mi Josua loa chun a hung lût a, lungpui lientak umna laia chun a ngîr ta zing a; chun, tawlailîr thing chu an chêk a, LALPA biekna dingin bâwngpuihai chu pumrawhmang thil inhlân dingin an hmang tah a.

en: And the Levites took down the ark of Jehovah, and the coffer that was with it, wherein the jewels of gold were, and put them on the great stone: and the men of Beth-shemesh offered burnt-offerings and sacrificed sacrifices the same day unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Levi chihai chun LALPA bâwm chu rângkachak thil hlu umna thingrem le chun an lâk thlâk a, lungpui chunga chun an sieh a; chun, Beth-semes khuoha mihai chun chu ni vêk chun pumrawhmang thil in- hlânhai le inthâwinahai chu LALPA kuomah an inhlân a.

en: And when the five lords of the Philistines had seen it, they returned to Ekron the same day.
hmr: Chu chu Philistin lal pangahai chun an hmu zo chun, chu ni le le chun Ekron khuo tieng an kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And these are the golden tumors which the Philistines returned for a trespass-offering unto Jehovah: for Ashdod one, for Gaza one, for Ashkelon one, for Gath one, for Ekron one;
hmr: Philistin mihaiin rângkachak ngâwt lim LALPA kuoma bawsietna inthâwina dinga an inhlân chu hieng zât hi a nih; Asdod khaw puolin pakhat, Gaza khaw puolin pakhat, Askelon khaw puolin pakhat, Gath khaw puolin pakhat, Ekron khaw puolin pakhat;

en: and the golden mice, according to the number of all the cities of the Philistines belonging to the five lords, both of fortified cities and of country villages, even unto the great stone, whereon they set down the ark of Jehovah, which stone remaineth unto this day in the field of Joshua the Beth-shemite.
hmr: chun, rângkachak chaichene lim chu khuo po po kul nei khuo le thingtlâng tieng khuo khawm tiem vawng a, lal pangahai ta Philistin mihai khaw zât a nih. LALPA bâwm an innghatna lungpui ngei chu Beth-semes khuoa mi Josua loa chun tu chen hin a la um zing a nih.

en: And he smote of the men of Beth-shemesh, because they had looked into the ark of Jehovah, he smote of the people seventy men, and fifty thousand men; and the people mourned, because Jehovah had smitten the people with a great slaughter.
hmr: Chun, LALPA bâwm sûng an en leiin Beth-semes khuoa mihai chu a hrem a, anni laia mi sîng nga le sâwmsari zet a hrem a; LALPAIN a hrem nasat êm leiin mihai chu an ṭap a.

en: And the men of Beth-shemesh said, Who is able to stand before Jehovah, this holy God? and to whom shall he go up from us?
hmr: Beth-semes khuoa mihai chun, “Hi Pathien inthieng LALPA hmaa hin tu am ngîr thei a ta, ei kuoma inthawk hi khâwlai am fe suok tâng a ta?” an ta.

en: And they sent messengers to the inhabitants of Kiriath-jearim, saying, The Philistines have brought back the ark of Jehovah; come ye down, and fetch it up to you.
hmr: Chuongchun, Kiriath-jearim khuoa mihai kuoma chun, “Philistin mihai chun LALPA bâwm chu an hung sie nâwk tah a, hung thla unla, in kuom tieng hung la ro khai,” tiha hril dingin mihai an tir a.

en: And the men of Kiriath-jearim came, and fetched up the ark of Jehovah, and brought it into the house of Abinadab in the hill, and sanctified Eleazar his son to keep the ark of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Kiriath-jearim khuoa mi- hai chu an zu feh a, LALPA bâwm chu an zu lâk a, tlânga Abinadab ina chun an lâklût a, a naupa Eleazar chu LALPA bâwm enkawltu dingin an suktum a.

en: And it came to pass, from the day that the ark abode in Kiriath-jearim, that the time was long; for it was twenty years: and all the house of Israel lamented after Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Kiriath-jearima bâwm a um sûng chu sâwttak a na, kum sâwmhni zet a nih; chun, Israel sûnghai po po chun LALPA chu an lunglên nâwk tah a.

en: And Samuel spake unto all the house of Israel, saying, If ye do return unto Jehovah with all your heart, then put away the foreign gods and the Ashtaroth from among you, and direct your hearts unto Jehovah, and serve him only; and he will deliver you out of the hand of the Philistines.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun Israel sûng- hai po po kuoma chun, “In lungril takzeta LALPA tieng hung ngha tak tak in ni chun, ram dang pathienhai le Astaroth dâm in laia chu sie hmang dai ta unla, in lungril chu LALPA ta dingin buotsai unla, ama rawng chau chu bâwl ro; chuongchun, Philistin mihai kuta inthawk hi a sansuok ding cheu a nih,” a ta.

en: Then the children of Israel did put away the Baalim and the Ashtaroth, and served Jehovah only.
hmr: Chun Israel mihai chun Baalhai le Astarothhai chu an sie hmang a, LALPA rawng chau chu an bâwl tah a.

en: And Samuel said, Gather all Israel to Mizpah, and I will pray for you unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun, “Israel mi- hai po po chu Mizpaah ko khâwm vawng unla, LALPA kuomah ṭawng- ṭaipêk ka ti cheu,” a ta.

en: And they gathered together to Mizpah, and drew water, and poured it out before Jehovah, and fasted on that day, and said there, We have sinned against Jehovah. And Samuel judged the children of Israel in Mizpah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Mizpaa chun an fe khâwm tah a; chun, tui an chawi a, LALPA hmaa chun an bunthlâk a, chu ni chun bu an nghei a, chutaka chun, “LALPA chunga chun ei lo suol tah a nih,” an ta. Chun, Samuel chun Mizpaa chun Israel mihai ro a rêl- pêk a.

en: And when the Philistines heard that the children of Israel were gathered together to Mizpah, the lords of the Philistines went up against Israel. And when the children of Israel heard it, they were afraid of the Philistines.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai chun Israel mihai Mizpaah an um khâwm ti an hriet chun Israel mihai do dingin Philistin lalhai chu an hang inthawk a. Chu chu Israel mihaiin an lo hriet chun Philistin mihai chu an lo ṭih a.

en: And the children of Israel said to Samuel, Cease not to cry unto Jehovah our God for us, that he will save us out of the hand of the Philistines.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel mihai chun Samuel kuoma chun, “Philistin mihai kuta mi sandam dinga LALPA i mi kopêk chu ma naw raw khai,” an ta.

en: And Samuel took a sucking lamb, and offered it for a whole burnt-offering unto Jehovah: and Samuel cried unto Jehovah for Israel; and Jehovah answered him.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun berâmte nêne ne lai a lâk a, pumrawhmang thilinhlân dingin LALPA kuomah ân hlân a, Israel mihai ta dingin Samuel chun LALPA chu a ko a; chun, LALPA chun a hung dawn a.

en: And as Samuel was offering up the burnt-offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel; but Jehovah thundered with a great thunder on that day upon the Philistines, and discomfited them; and they were smitten down before Israel.
hmr: Chun, Samuelin pumrawhmang thilinhlân ân hlân lai tak chun Philistin mihai chun Israel mihai chu thaw dingin an hung hnai a, nisien- lakhawm, chu ni chun LALPAIN Philistin mihai chungah vân nasa- takin ân rûmtir ta dur dur el a, a sukbuoi tah a; Israel mihai hmaa chun an tlâwm ta dêr el a.

en: And the men of Israel went out of Mizpah, and pursued the Philistines, and smote them, until they came under Beth-car.
hmr: Chun, Israel mihai chu Mizpaa inthawk chun an suok a, Philistin mihai chu an hnawt a, Beth-kar hnuoi an tlung chenin an that pei a.

en: Then Samuel took a stone, and set it between Mizpah and Shen, and called the name of it Eben-ezer, saying, Hitherto hath Jehovah helped us.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samuel chun lung a lâk a, Mizpa le Sen inkâra chun a phun a, “Hi chen hi LALPAIN a mi ṭhangpui a nih,” tiin a hminga chun Ebenezer ân bûk a.

en: So the Philistines were subdued, and they came no more within the border of Israel: and the hand of Jehovah was against the Philistines all the days of Samuel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Philistin mihai chu an tlâwm tah a, Israelhai rama chun an fe nâwk ta nawh a. Chun, LALPA kut chun Philistin mihai chu Samuel dam sûng po chun a tai ta zing a.

en: And the cities which the Philistines had taken from Israel were restored to Israel, from Ekron even unto Gath; and the border thereof did Israel deliver out of the hand of the Philistines. And there was peace between Israel and the Amorites.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihaiin Israel- hai khuo an lâkhai chu Ekrona inthawka Gath chenin Israel mihai an pêk kîr nâwk a, a ram chu Israel mihaiin Philistin mihai kuta in- thawkin an sansuok a. Chun, Israel mihai le Amor mihai chu inremin an um a.

en: And Samuel judged Israel all the days of his life.
hmr: Samuel chun a dam sûngin Israel mihai ro a rêl a.

en: And he went from year to year in circuit to Beth-el, and Gilgal, and Mizpah; and he judged Israel in all those places.
hmr: Kum tinin Bethel le Gilgal le Mizpa hi a kan vêl hlak a, chuong hmunahai chun Israel mihai ro a rêl hlak a.

en: And his return was to Ramah, for there was his house; and there he judged Israel: and he built there an altar unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, a in umna a ni leiin Rama khuoa chun a fe nâwk hlak a; chutaka chun Israel mihai ro a rêl a, chutaka chun LALPA ta dingin mâichâm a siem a.

en: And it came to pass, when Samuel was old, that he made his sons judges over Israel.
hmr: Samuel chu a hung upa tah a, a naupasalhai chu Israel mihai chunga rorêltuhaiah a siem a.

en: Now the name of his first-born was Joel; and the name of his second, Abijah: they were judges in Beer-sheba.
hmr: A nau lutir hming chu Joel a na, chun, a dawttu hming chu Abija a nih; anni chu Beer-sebaa rorêltu an na.

en: And his sons walked not in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted justice.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a nauhai chun a umdân chu an lâk ve nawh a, sum le pai tieng an hnawt a, thamnahai an lâk a, indik nawtakin ro an rêl a.

en: Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together, and came to Samuel unto Ramah;
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel mi upahai po po chu an inkhâwm a, Rama khuoa Samuel kuomah an feh a,

en: and they said unto him, Behold, thou art old, and thy sons walk not in thy ways: now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.
hmr: a kuomah, “Ngai ta, i hung upa ta hle el a, i naupasalhai hlak chun i umdân hi an lâk ve dêr si nawh a; hnam danghai po po ang bawka kan chunga ro mi rêlpêk dingin lal mi siempêk raw khai,” an ta.

en: But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, Give us a king to judge us. And Samuel prayed unto Jehovah.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a kuoma, “Ro mi rêlpêktu ding lal mi pe rawh,” an ti chun Samuel chu a suklâwm naw hleh a. Chuongchun, Samuel chu LALPA kuomah a ṭawngṭai a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Samuel, Hearken unto the voice of the people in all that they say unto thee; for they have not rejected thee, but they have rejected me, that I should not be king over them.
hmr: LALPA chun Samuel kuoma chun, “Mipuihaiin i kuoma an hril po po chu ngai rawh, nang dit naw che an ni nawh a; an chunga lal dinga kei mi dit lo an ni lem.

en: According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even unto this day, in that they have forsaken me, and served other gods, so do they also unto thee.
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawka ka ṭhuoi suok nia tuta chena an thil thaw dân po po, an mi nghatsan a, pathien danghai rawng dâm an mi bâwlsan hlak ang bawk hin i chungah an thaw a ni hi.

en: Now therefore hearken unto their voice: howbeit thou shalt protest solemnly unto them, and shalt show them the manner of the king that shall reign over them.
hmr: Chuleiin, an thu ngai rawh, amiruokchu, ursûntaka tiemkamin an chunga rorêltu lal châng dân ding chu khîkhmu chie rawh,” a ta.

en: And Samuel told all the words of Jehovah unto the people that asked of him a king.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun LALPA thuhai po po chu lal hnitu mipuihai chu a hril vawng a.

en: And he said, This will be the manner of the king that shall reign over you: he will take your sons, and appoint them unto him, for his chariots, and to be his horsemen; and they shall run before his chariots;
hmr: “In chunga rorêltu lal châng dân ding chu hieng ang hi nîng a tih: in naupasalhai chu a sakawr le a tawlailîr chuongpuia hai ruot a ta, a tawlailîr hmaa tlânhai dâm um an ta;

en: and he will appoint them unto him for captains of thousands, and captains of fifties; and he will set some to plow his ground, and to reap his harvest, and to make his instruments of war, and the instruments of his chariots.
hmr: chun, a sipai sâng hotua dâm, sâwmnga hotua dâm ruot a tih; ṭhenkhat chu a hnuoi inlettua dâm, a busîktua dâm, a indo thuomhnaw siemtua dâm, tawlailîr hmangruo siemtua dâm hmang a ta.

en: And he will take your daughters to be perfumers, and to be cooks, and to be bakers.
hmr: In naunuhmeihai chu rimin- hnik siemtua dâm, bu suongtua dâm, bei siemtua dâm hmang a tih.

en: And he will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your oliveyards, even the best of them, and give them to his servants.
hmr: In lohai, in grêp huonhai, oliv huonhai, a ṭha ṭhahai chu lâkpêk a ti cheu a, a siehlawhai pêng a tih.

en: And he will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give to his officers, and to his servants.
hmr: In thlai chi le in grêp huonhaia mi chu sâwma pakhat lâkpêk a ti cheu a, a siehlawhai le a hotuhai pêng a tih.

en: And he will take your men-servants, and your maid-servants, and your goodliest young men, and your asses, and put them to his work.
hmr: In siehlawpahai, in siehlaw- nuhai, in tlangvâl ṭha ṭhahai le in sabengtunghai lâkpêk a ti cheu a, a sinthaw dingin ruoi a tih.

en: He will take the tenth of your flocks: and ye shall be his servants.
hmr: In berâm ruol laia mi chu sâwma pakhat lâkpêk a ti cheu a; chun, ama siehlawhai nîng in tih.

en: And ye shall cry out in that day because of your king whom ye shall have chosen you; and Jehovah will not answer you in that day.
hmr: Chun, chu nia chun in la thlang ding in lal lei chun la khêk suok in ta, nisienlakhawm, chu nia chun LALPAIN dawn naw ni cheu,” a ta.

en: But the people refused to hearken unto the voice of Samuel; and they said, Nay: but we will have a king over us,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mipuihai chun Samuel rawl chu an ngai nuom nawh a, “Ni lo e, lal kan nei ding a nih,

en: that we also may be like all the nations, and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.
hmr: chuongchun, hnam dang po pohai ang hung nîng kan ta, chun, kan lal chun ro mi rêlpêk a ta, kan hmahai chu ṭhuoiin râlhai mi dopui a tih,” an ta.

en: And Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun mipui thuhrilhai po po chu a hriet a, LALPA naa chun a thun nâwk sâwng a.

en: And Jehovah said to Samuel, Hearken unto their voice, and make them a king. And Samuel said unto the men of Israel, Go ye every man unto his city.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Samuel kuomah, “An rawl chu ngai la, lal siempêk rawh,” a ta. Chun, Samuel chun Israel mihai kuomah, “Mi tin mâni khuo sengah fe ta ro,” a ta.

en: Now there was a man of Benjamin, whose name was Kish, the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Becorath, the son of Aphiah, the son of a Benjamite, a mighty man of valor.
hmr: Benjamin rama Benjamin thlaa mi mi pakhat mi hrât huoisen a um a, a hming chu Kis a nih; ama chu Abiel naupa a na, ama chu Zeror naupa a na, ama chu Bekorath naupa a na, ama chu Aphia naupa a nih.

en: And he had a son, whose name was Saul, a young man and a goodly: and there was not among the children of Israel a goodlier person than he: from his shoulders and upward he was higher than any of the people.
hmr: Chun, ama chun naupa a nei a, a hming chu Saula a nih; tlangvâl pieng ṭhatak a na, Israel mihai laia chun ama nêka pieng ṭha hrim hrim an um nawh a, a liengko nêka insâng mi dang hrim hrim an um nawh.

en: And the asses of Kish, Saul’s father, were lost. And Kish said to Saul his son, Take now one of the servants with thee, and arise, go seek the asses.
hmr: Chun, Saula pa Kis sabengtung- hai chu ân hmang tâwl a. Chuong- chun, Kis chun a naupa Saula kuoma chun, “Tho la, siehlaw pakhat ṭhuoi la, sabengtunghai va zawng raw khai,” a ta.

en: And he passed through the hill-country of Ephraim, and passed through the land of Shalishah, but they found them not: then they passed through the land of Shaalim, and there they were not: and he passed through the land of the Benjamites, but they found them not.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ephraim tlâng ram dâm chu a fang a, chun Salisa ram dâm khawm chu a fang a, nisien- lakhawm, a hmu nawh a; chun, Saalim ram an fang nâwk a, chutaka khawm chun an um nawh a; chun, Benjamin mihai ram an fang nâwk a, nisienlakhawm, an hmu chuong ta nawh a.

en: When they were come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant that was with him, Come, and let us return, lest my father leave off caring for the asses, and be anxious for us.
hmr: Zuph ram an tlung chun, Saula chun a kuoma um ve, a siehlaw kuoma chun, “Hung rawh, kîr nâwk el tâng ei tih, chuong naw chun, ka pa khan sabengtunghai ngaituo ṭhulin eini mi ngaituo lem a tih,” a ta.

en: And he said unto him, Behold now, there is in this city a man of God, and he is a man that is held in honor; all that he saith cometh surely to pass: now let us go thither; peradventure he can tell us concerning our journey whereon we go.
hmr: Ama chun a kuomah, “Ngai ta, hi khuoa hin Pathien mi a um a, mi inzaumtak a na, a hril taphawt chu a hung tlung ngei ngei hlak a nih, hung rawh, chutaka chun va fêng ei tih, ei fena dâm hi a mi hril thei miel rawi mawh,” a ta.

en: Then said Saul to his servant, But, behold, if we go, what shall we bring the man? for the bread is spent in our vessels, and there is not a present to bring to the man of God: what have we?
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chun a siehlaw kuoma chun, “Anachu, fe ta ang ni inla, ama chu ieng am chawipêk ei ta? Ei bâwma bei hlak a um ta si nawh a. Pathien mi ta dinga lâwmman chawi ding a um dêr nawh, ieng am ei nei aw?” a ta.

en: And the servant answered Saul again, and said, Behold, I have in my hand the fourth part of a shekel of silver: that will I give to the man of God, to tell us our way.
hmr: Siehlaw chun Saula chu a dawn nâwk a, “Ngai ta, tangka Shekel hmun lia ṭhea hmun khat ka la chawi a, chu chu ei fena ding a mi hril manah Pathien mi chu pe el ka tih,” a ta.

en: (Beforetime in Israel, when a man went to inquire of God, thus he said, Come, and let us go to the seer; for he that is now called a Prophet was beforetime called a Seer.)
hmr: (Kha hma khan chu Israelhai lai khan miin Pathien an râwn nuom chun, “Hung rawh, hmutheitu kuomah fêng ei tih,” an ti hlak a; tulaia Zâwlnei an ti hlak hi, kha hma khan chu Hmutheitu an ti hlak a nih.)

en: Then said Saul to his servant, Well said; come, let us go. So they went unto the city where the man of God was.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun a siehlaw kuoma chun, “A ṭha hlau chu, fe ta nâwm ei nîm”, a ta. Chuongchun, Pathien mi umna khuoa chun an fe tah a.

en: As they went up the ascent to the city, they found young maidens going out to draw water, and said unto them, Is the seer here?
hmr: Khaw hang pannaa an hang fe lai chun nunghâk tui chawi dinga hung suokhai an hmuh a, an kuomah, “Hitaka hin Hmutheitu chu a um am?” an ta.

en: And they answered them, and said, He is; behold, he is before thee: make haste now, for he is come to-day into the city; for the people have a sacrifice to-day in the high place.
hmr: Anni chun an dawn a, “Um e, in hmaa khan a hung a nih, inhmaw ro khai, vawisûn hin khuoah a hung a nih, vawisûn hin bâwlhmunahai mihai an inthâwi a nih,

en: As soon as ye are come into the city, ye shall straightway find him, before he goeth up to the high place to eat; for the people will not eat until he come, because he doth bless the sacrifice; and afterwards they eat that are bidden. Now therefore get you up; for at this time ye shall find him.
hmr: khuo in hang lût hlimin bâwlhmuna bu fa dinga a fe hmain hang hmu nghâl el in tih; in- thâwina malsâwmtu ding a ni leiin a tlung hmakhat chu mipui chun bu an fâk naw ding a nih, chu hnunga chun an mi fielhai chun an fâk hlak a nih. Chuleiin, hang fe vak unla, hang hmu nghâl el in tih,” an ta.

en: And they went up to the city; and as they came within the city, behold, Samuel came out toward them, to go up to the high place.
hmr: Chuongchun, khuoa chun an hang fe tah a. Khuo an hang lût chun, Samuel bâwlhmuna fe ding chun ân tuokpui a.

en: Now Jehovah had revealed unto Samuel a day before Saul came, saying,
hmr: Chun, Saula hung hma ni khata chun LALPA chun Samuel chu a lo hril rûk a,

en: To-morrow about this time I will send thee a man out of the land of Benjamin, and thou shalt anoint him to be prince over my people Israel; and he shall save my people out of the hand of the Philistines: for I have looked upon my people, because their cry is come unto me.
hmr: “Zîngah hieng ang hun lai hin Benjamin rama inthawkin i kuomah mi pakhat ka hung tir ding a na, ka mi Israel chunga hotu ni dingin hriek nâl i ta, ama chun Philistin mihai kuta inthawkin ka mihai sandam a tih; an khêkri chun ka kuom a hung tlung ta leiin ka mihai chu ka ngaisak tah a nih,” tiin.

en: And when Samuel saw Saul, Jehovah said unto him, Behold, the man of whom I spake to thee! this same shall have authority over my people.
hmr: Chun, Samuelin Saula a hmu chun, LALPAIN a kuomah, “En ta, i kuoma ka mi hril kha, ama hin ka mihai chungah thu nei a tih,” a ta.

en: Then Saul drew near to Samuel in the gate, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, where the seer’s house is.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chun kul kawtkhâra chun Samuel chu a va hnai a, “Hmutheitu in chu khâwlai am a na, mi hril ta,” a ta.

en: And Samuel answered Saul, and said, I am the seer; go up before me unto the high place, for ye shall eat with me to-day: and in the morning I will let thee go, and will tell thee all that is in thy heart.
hmr: Samuel chun Saula chu a dawn a, “Keima hi hmutheitu chu ka nih, ka hmaa hin bâwlhmun tieng panin fe la, vawisûn hin ka kuomah bu i fâk ve ding a nih; chun, zîngah zîngkâr infetir ka ti cheh a, i lungrila um po po khawm hril ka ti che.

en: And as for thine asses that were lost three days ago, set not thy mind on them; for they are found. And for whom is all that is desirable in Israel? Is it not for thee, and for all thy father’s house?
hmr: I sabengtung ni thum inhmang tahai chu lungkham naw rawh, an hmu tah. Israelhai laia ropuina po po chu tu ta ding am a na? I ta ding le i pa ina mi po pohai ta ding a ni naw am a nih?” a ta.

en: And Saul answered and said, Am not I a Benjamite, of the smallest of the tribes of Israel? and my family the least of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? wherefore then speakest thou to me after this manner?
hmr: Saula chun a dawn a, “Israel hnam laia chîntak, Benjamin hnam ka ni naw am a nih? Chun, kan sûngkuo khawm Benjamin hnam sûngkuo lai po poa chîntak a ni naw am a nih? iengtiziea ka kuoma hienga hril am i nih a?” a ta.

en: And Samuel took Saul and his servant, and brought them into the guest-chamber, and made them sit in the chiefest place among them that were bidden, who were about thirty persons.
hmr: Samuel chun Saula le a siehlaw chu a ṭhuoi a, mikhuol pindana chun a ṭhuoi lût a, an mi fiel sâwmthumhai lai chun hmun ropuitaka chun ân ṭhungtir a.

en: And Samuel said unto the cook, Bring the portion which I gave thee, of which I said unto thee, Set it by thee.
hmr: Chun, Samuel chun bu suongtu kuoma chun, “I kuoma sietum ding ka ti, chanvo ka pêk che kha hung la raw khai,” a ta.

en: And the cook took up the thigh, and that which was upon it, and set it before Saul. And Samuel said, Behold, that which hath been reserved! set it before thee and eat; because unto the appointed time hath it been kept for thee, for I said, I have invited the people. So Saul did eat with Samuel that day.
hmr: Chuongchun, bu suongtu chun a mal le a chunga um chu a hung lâk a, Saula hmaa chun a va sieh a. Chun, Samuel chun, “En ta, ka lo sietum hi! awt la fa rawh khai, hi huna dingin hi hi kan lo ruotpêk hrim che a nih, ‘Mi dâm ka fiel khâwm ie,’ ka ti bawk sih a,” a ta. Chuongchun, chu ni chun Saula chu Samuel hai le chun bu thlêng chu an awt hmunkhat tah a.

en: And when they were come down from the high place into the city, he communed with Saul upon the housetop.
hmr: Chun, bâwlhmuna inthawka khuoa an fe thla chun in chungah Saula chu zâlna an siempêk a; a zâl tah a.

en: And they arose early: and it came to pass about the spring of the day, that Samuel called to Saul on the housetop, saying, Up, that I may send thee away. And Saul arose, and they went out both of them, he and Samuel, abroad.
hmr: Chun, zîngkâr chun a tho a, nisa suok ding lai vêlin Samuel chun in chunga um Saula chu a ko a, “Tho la, infetir tâng ka ti che,” a ta. Chuongchun, Saula chu a tho a, ama le Samuel chu an fe suok tah a.

en: As they were going down at the end of the city, Samuel said to Saul, Bid the servant pass on before us (and he passed on), but stand thou still first, that I may cause thee to hear the word of God.
hmr: Khaw hmawrtâwng chu an zuk tlung chun, Samuel chun Saula kuomah, “Siehlaw hi ei hma tieng infetir la, (ama chu a fe tah a) nang ruok chu ngîr hri la, Pathien thu hang hril hri phawt ka ti che,” a ta.
